story:
Berkeley High School's production of The Vagina Monologues is a completely student-organized and -directed collaboration. This is the fourteenth consecutive year that The Vagina Monologues has been performed at BHS, one of the only high schools in the world to produce and perform the show. 

Traditionally, 100% of proceeds from the show are donated to local charities working to end violence against women. This year, production costs were added to our budget. Since we are dedicated to our goal of donating the money we raise from ticket sales to charity, we have decided to use crowdsourcing in an attempt to raise the money that our school district is requiring we pay in order to use the theater. 

The Vagina Monologues is a powerful show that educates, inspires, and empowers. Your donations are much appreciated, and will help us further educate our community and create a lasting impact in the lives of many women. 

If you are interested in seeing the show, we are performing on February 12, 13, 20, and 21 at 7pm in the Florence Schwimley Little Theater at Berkeley High School. 

Thank you!

story:
ABOUT THIS PROJECT

Megan Bascom & Dancers (MB&D) will be presented for the fourth time by Triskelion Arts this April 25-26th at their new location in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, premiering our latest project SAID.I.MEANT in the Muriel Schulman Theater. It is incredibly exciting to be one of the first few companies presenting work in this new theater and we look forward to sharing this evening of work with you. This is MB&D’s second evening-length work, and SAID.I.MEANT is the company’s largest project to date! We are a company of 18 collaborating artists, including 15 dancers, a composer, costume designer, and graphic designer. Additionally our staff, a company manager and administrative intern, are helping move this season forward behind the scenes.

Please help us cover the costs of developing SAID.I.MEANT, including rehearsals, dancers' stipends, original sound score, costumes, set design and administrative costs, with a tax-deductible donation. Though our Indiegogo goal is $5,000, the goal for the entire campaign, fully covering the costs of the premiere of SAID.I.MEANT, is $10,000. We are hosting the remainder of this fundraising campaign through Fractured Atlas, MB&D's Fiscal Sponsor. 

Your donation will help keep us moving not only through the premiere of SAID.I.MEANT but also through the remainder of the calendar year. We've set a goal to increase our company's impact in the community by teaching more, offering workshops, and engaging and promoting fellow artists with opportunities like the curated Showcase we hosted at APAP|NYC 2015 this January. We are hosting our first company workshop in early April and have more performances lined up for May and June. Your support will help us keep our momentum going! 


ABOUT SAID.I.MEANT

SAID.I.MEANT is a distillation of experiences. It is a project that reflects transition, relocation, and the elements of life that wash away and get left behind. Exploring the components that cause change, whether sudden and forced or gradual and chosen, this work considers the flotsam and jetsam that come and go with time, effecting memory, tradition, and identity.

We are so grateful to count you as our supporting friends and backers!

Thank you,

Megan Bascom, Artistic Director

Along with the collaborators:Emily Craver, Larry Daniels, Ally Delle Grotti, Sammy Donahue, Anthony Shevlin Gonzales, Cale Hawkins, Jordan Holland, Mary Madsen, Heidi Morgan, Jill Pajer, Jenna Purcell, Collin Ranf, Kristen Rizzuto, Matthew Roth, Julie Seal, Marion Spencer, Katy Telfer, Caitlin Yuhas.

www.meganbascomanddancers.org


*Photo © Mike Abbatiello

**Please check if your employer will match a donation. It is often the quickest and easiest way to make your donation go farther for MB&D! Thank you!
story_txt:
ABOUT THIS PROJECT
Megan Bascom & Dancers (MB&D) will be presented for the fourth time by Triskelion Arts this April 25-26th at their new location in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, premiering our latest project SAID.I.MEANT in the Muriel Schulman Theater. It is incredibly exciting to be one of the first few companies presenting work in this new theater and we look forward to sharing this evening of work with you. This is MB&D’s second evening-length work, and SAID.I.MEANT is the company’s largest project to date! We are a company of 18 collaborating artists, including 15 dancers, a composer, costume designer, and graphic designer. Additionally our staff, a company manager and administrative intern, are helping move this season forward behind the scenes.Please help us cover the costs of developing SAID.I.MEANT, including rehearsals, dancers' stipends, original sound score, costumes, set design and administrative costs, with a tax-deductible donation. Though our Indiegogo goal is $5,000, the goal for the entire campaign, fully covering the costs of the premiere of SAID.I.MEANT, is $10,000. We are hosting the remainder of this fundraising campaign through Fractured Atlas, MB&D's Fiscal Sponsor. Your donation will help keep us moving not only through the premiere of SAID.I.MEANT but also through the remainder of the calendar year. We've set a goal to increase our company's impact in the community by teaching more, offering workshops, and engaging and promoting fellow artists with opportunities like the curated Showcase we hosted at APAP|NYC 2015 this January. story:
Our Show

7 Towers continues its 5th season in Austin with Patrick Marber's intensely personal drama CLOSER. 

This exceedingly dark comedy offers us a chance to produce a love story...7 Towers-style. 

CLOSER examines the destructive and deceitful relationships of four people in London. Alice, the young stripper, meets Dan, who writes obituaries, after an accident. Dan meets Anna, the photographer, while trying to promote his new book. Larry, the doctor, stumbles upon Dan (pretending to be Anna) in an internet chat room.  Larry finds Anna at the aquarium. From there, the four play at loving one another, though they cannot seem to keep their relationships and the boundaries between them straight . Alice loves Dan. Dan loves Alice, but also Anna. Anna loves Larry, but also Dan. Larry loves sex. They switch partners, switch back, and are utterly truthful in the most inconvenient moments about the terrible things they’ve done to one another.

CLOSER is the beautifully crafted, clever, and gut wrenching story of how utterly horrible humans can be to the ones we think we love.

What We Need & What You Get

Your donations go directly toward paying for our space and paying our amazing talented team. CLOSER marks 7 Towers’ third production at The Dougherty Arts Center, and our third attempt at using the space in an interesting and creative way. Two years ago, we experimented with projections and puppetry in The Pillowman. Last summer, we flipped the space completely for All’s Well That Ends Well, building a massive set on the traditional audience risers. For CLOSER, we’re creating an intimate black box feel on the DAC stage.

7 Towers has assembled an incredible team of artist to bring this play to life. We'd very much like to compensate for their commitment, artistry, and passion. 

That team includes: Amanda Gass (director), Katy Billik (producer, costume design), Christina Gutierrez (artistic director, producer), Courtney DeGinder (lighting and projections design), Ally Botek (stage management), as well as well-known Austin actors Suzanne Balling, David J. Boss, Sara Cormier, and Chris Hejl, and Aaron Black on fight choreography. 

Your donations of any size will affect our production immensely, and allow us to bring to life this beautifully painful scrutiny of the human heart 

Since CLOSER allows a very, very up-close and personal look at its characters, we've decided to get up-close and personal with our perks! Along with things like sweet, sweet recognition, we've got things on offer from our cast and crew that speak to our strengths...and a few to our weaknesses. Check them out and see what gets you excited!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, be sure to share our campaign with friends and family, and come see our gritty love story, running July 17-August 2 at the Dougherty Arts Center.

story:
Segítsd te is az Erzsébet téri Salsát

Évek óta szervezünk salsás eseményeket Budapest szerte, többek közt az Erzsébet téren is. Szerencsére szeretitek a programjainkat, így szép lassan jó nagyra nőtt a rendezvény.

Elértük az akkumulátoros hangtechnikából kihozható maximumot, a lehetséges fejlesztési irány az, hogy megoldjuk az áramellátást a téren, így komolyabb hangtechnikát tudunk használni.

Áramfejlesztővel jobb lesz

Kipróbáltuk a dolgot és a szezonnyitóra béreltünk egy áramfejlesztőt, így tudtuk használni a normál 230V-os hangfalainkat is. Eredményes volt a próba, sokkal élvezhetőbb volt a zene, sőt a szökőkút másik oldalára is tudtunk már terjeszkedni.
A második ET salsán vissza tértünk a régi hangtechnikához, amit egyből észre is vettetek és szóvá is tettetek.

Elhatároztuk hát, hogy vásárolunk egy áramfejlesztőt, hogy profi maradhasson az ET salsa lebonyolítása.

Ez drága, dobjuk össze együtt

A becsületkasszás felajánlásokból 4 év alatt darabról-darabra fejlesztettük az akkumulátoros hangtechnikánkat, de most egy nagyobb beruházásra van szükség, amit már nem tudunk finanszírozni a rendezvényeken összedobott forrásokból.
Úgy határoztunk, hogy kipróbáljuk a közösségi finanszírozást, reméljük ti is szeretitek annyira a rendezvényt, mint mi, és támogatjátok kezdeményezésünket.

Az áramfejlesztő

Több mérést végeztünk a döntés előtt, úgy gondoljuk, hogy elég nekünk egy viszonylag kis teljesítményű, úgy 1000 wattos eszköz, amit elsősorban nem ipari felhasználásra, hanem érzékenyebb elektronikákhoz terveztek. Fontos szempont a halk és környezetbarát üzem, valamint hogy könnyen tudjuk szállítani a cuccot.

Ezt néztük ki:

http://www.szerszamvilag.hu/termekek/benzinmotoros-aramfejleszto-10kva-230v-hordozhato-szabalyozott-digitalis-kimdgi-10sp

A listaára a készüléknek úgy 200.000 Ft, de egy támogatónknak köszönhetően sikerül 130.000 Ft-ért hozzájutni. Erre jön még az Indiegogo és PayPal költsége, így kalkulációnk szerint kb. 155.000 Ft-ot kell összegyűjtenünk a generátor finanszírozására. Segítesz?

Kéne?

Sokszor kölcsönadtuk már ingyenesen az eszközeinket különféle nonprofit kezdeményezéseknek, eztán is így teszünk majd. Ha esetleg szívesen használnád a generátort, te is elkérheted néhány napra, csak annyit kérünk (ha nem nonprofit közösségi kezdeményezéshez kell) válaszd valamelyik kölcsönzős hozzájárulási csomagot.

Kösz!

Köszönjük, ha segítesz! Találkozunk az Erzsébet téren, a Várban vagy valamelyik másik táncos eseményünkön.

story:
Hot nights, dirty streets, young love and death is in the air!

Mosaic Acting Ensemble invites you to help us realize our vision for Romeo and Juliet: You Only Live Once.

Mosaic is a brand new multi-ethnic acting ensemble committed to telling great stories, simply and truthfully; stories that explore, both within our own ensemble and with a wider audience, the differing beliefs that tend to divide our community; stories that also illuminate the common values and aspirations that bind us all together.

"For never was a story of more woe

Than this of Juliet and her Romeo."

Perhaps no story is as well-known as that of Romeo and Juliet, re-imagined over the years in various artistic forms.

Romeo & Juliet, with its star-crossed lovers destroyed by Tybalt's hatred and the long running antagonism between  two noble families, the wealthy Capulet's and now empoverished Montague's, was chosen as our first production because of its timely nature and eternal promise. 

Mosaic's version of this timeless story pushes Romeo Juliet into an alternate multi-verse, where democracy never took hold, the telephone was never discovered, and letters (gasp!) are the main way folks communicate with each other.

We believe that this visceral and compelling production will promote dialogue, first in our audience, then hopefully in our community, dialogue  that has the potential for fostering real change, dialogue that counters the human psyche's propensity to demonize the "other".

October 9-10 and 16-17, 2015 at the Attic Theater, Culver City, CA. 

How you can help

In order to realize the vision we have for Romeo & Juliet:  You Only Live Once we need your help to fully fund a very simple production :

  • Rehearsal and performance space - $2400
  • Set - $750
  • Props - $175
  • Insurance - $525
  • Stipend for Fight Choreographer - $200
  • Miscellaneous - $450
  • Total - $4500

Through previous donations, other fundraising efforts and our own personal funds, we have raised  or committed $3500 towards our total budget of $4500.

Your help will have a huge, direct impact on the success of this production. Moreover, it will help us succeed in our mission of bringing accessible, unexpected, quality theater to our community.

story:
WHO WE ARE:
Our names are David Morrissey, Joe Rubino, and Andrew Beck, and we need your help.

We are Bluebox Theatre Company. We are a relatively new theatre and performing arts company founded in Long Island, NY. Our goal is to bring new visions and people to live theatre with original content and unique takes on classic and contemporary works.

Our styles and practices reflect the needs not only of artists, but for the community as a whole. We want to create more creative work opportunities for the artists around us, and above all, we aim to present a unique opportunity to bring new audiences to the theater.

Our campaign is important because it means more fair job opportunities for artists, as well as more exposure to live performance to people who might not usually enjoy theatre. We as a company pick nontraditional shows. Our target is young adults ages 16 to 35, which is also the market thats most lacking in even multi million dollar Broadway shows. We want to help fix that by exposing people to something different, and our next show Down the Road

In 2013, we produced the New York premiere of Night of the Living Dead on stage for the Performing Arts Studio in Port Jefferson, NY. SInce then we've put on five shows, including the thriller “Bug” by Tracy Letts. After Down the Road, we are going to produce Night of the Living Dead, Art, a christmas one act festival, and a Star Wars themed AIDS benefit.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP:
Fresh off of a successful adaptation of Bug, the plan is to produce Down the Road by Lee Blessing. The play has a built in audience and Long Island theatre companies don't produce the show often. We need YOUR help to make this show the best it can possibly be. 


Theatre is a costly venture, and we need you to help fund our dream so the Long Island community can be aware of the top notch shows we put on. We have already raised a lot of our funds, but are looking to raise $800 more to cover the costs of:

-Rehearsal/ performance space
-Performance rights and Licensing
-Actor stipends
-Professional sets/props
-Marketing solutions and advertising
-Playbills, scripts, and show posters.



SYNOPSIS AND IMPACT:
Lee Blessing's provocative piece travels down a dark and frightening road into the mind of a serial killer. First presented at La Jolla Playhouse, and subsequently presented as part of the Humana Festival of New American Plays at Actors Theatre of Louisville.

DOWN THE ROAD centers on a convicted serial killer and the husband and wife writing team hired to help him write an account of his crimes. The killer, Bill Reach, has admitted to the murders of nineteen women, but there may have been more. Over many weeks of interviews, the couple—Dan and Iris Henniman—grow more and more uncertain of the ethics of what they are doing. Are they simply relating terrifying events, or are they helping readers consume rape, murder and mutilation as if they are consuming any other product of our society? Are they, in fact, helping to turn Bill Reach into a celebrity?

"…compelling theater…Blessing has a penchant (and a skill) for probing his chosen issues with intelligence and respect for their complexity, his dramatic style is clear and simple." —Variety. "With DOWN THE ROAD, Blessing again shows his superiority at presenting an intellectual yet emotional look at the various facets of a twisted, virtually unsolvable issue. And if a play's success is measured by how much it disturbs emotions and stimulates the discussion, DOWN THE ROAD ranks as a major achievement." —Variety. "It's a delicately textured, beautifully balanced morality play in the guise of a psychological drama. It is the most serious and intellectually rewarding play to have appeared this year." —LA Herald Examiner.



WHAT YOU GET:
If you look below, we have various perks you will receive as incentive to help us out! We wish to extend our eternal gratitude to you, just for looking at our campaign.

story:
Ali Landers Choreographer/Instructor and Dancer

   I've been dancing and doing choreography with an all inclusive dance company for the last 3 years. This is where my heart is! We are a dance company with the ability to change people's perspectives about dance and about disabilities. We performed for 7 different audiences this year, and it's our intention to bring awareness to even more people in the years to come. All inclusive, means anyone is able to dance with us, regardless of age, cognitive challenges or ability. We are a family of dancers.
 My other credentials include a Dance Minor, Dance Instructor, Personal Trainer and Certified in Somatic Dance Therapy.

    It is my intention to shift our perspective from dis-ability to Ability. Anyone can dance! Anyone! As long as they have a heart pumping, they can dance!

   I've been invited to a Summer Dance Intensive with Axis Dance Company.
 http://www.axisdance.org/
AXIS exists to change the face of dance and disability.

   AXIS Dance Company has become one of the world’s most acclaimed and innovative ensembles of performers with and without disabilities. Founded in 1987, AXIS has paved the way for a powerful contemporary dance form called physically integrated dance.
I have received a small scholarship to attend this week long training, in August, in Oakland, CA.

    I need your assistance to get me all the way!
I'll need to pay for the rest of my tuition $ 375, room and board $25-60 a day, food $20 a day and plane ticket $ 90-150.

    My promise to you

       With this training, I will come back to my community, in Boise, brimming with passion and inspiration to give back!
    My first goal is Community Based Inclusive Dance classes. I'll gain knowledge from experts on some of the best approaches and methods of Integrative Dance.
    My next goal is to inject this inspiration into my choreography and work with Open Arms Dance Project!! It's my intention that we continue to blow minds and bring awareness to Abilities & Disabilities through Dance!
    My third goal is a Workshop incorporating my training for any Instructors wanting to gain understanding into Inclusive Dance techniques.

    Feel free to ask me any questions
    All it will take is 200 people contributing $5 each!!
    Thank you,

    Ali
story_txt:
Ali Landers Choreographer/Instructor and Dancer
   I've been dancing and doing choreography with an all inclusive dance company for the last 3 years. This is where my heart is! We are a dance company with the ability to change people's perspectives about dance and about disabilities. We performed for 7 different audiences this year, and it's our intention to bring awareness to even more people in the years to come. All inclusive, means anyone is able to dance with us, regardless of age, cognitive challenges or ability. We are a family of dancers. My other credentials include a Dance Minor, Dance Instructor, Personal Trainer and Certified in Somatic Dance Therapy.    It is my intention to shift our perspective from dis-ability to Ability. Anyone can dance! Anyone! As long as they have a heart pumping, they can dance!    I've been invited to a Summer Dance Intensive with Axis Dance Company.  http://www.axisdance.org/AXIS exists to change the face of dance and disability.    AXIS 
Dance Company has become one of the world’s most acclaimed and 
innovative ensembles of performers with and without disabilities. 
Founded in 1987, AXIS has paved the way for a powerful contemporary 
dance form called physically integrated dance.I have received a small scholarship to attend this week long training, in August, in Oakland, CA.    I need your assistance to get me all the way!I'll need to pay for the rest of my tuition $ 375, room and board $25-60 a day, food $20 a day and plane ticket $ 90-150. 
  
My promise to you
   With this training, I will come back to my community, in Boise, brimming with passion and inspiration to give back!My first goal is Community Based Inclusive Dance classes. I'll gain knowledge from experts on some of the best approaches and methods of Integrative Dance. My next goal is to inject this inspiration into my choreography and work with Open Arms Dance Project!! It's my intention that we continue to blow minds and bring awareness to Abilities & Disabilities through Dance! My third goal is a Workshop incorporating my training for any Instructors wanting to gain understanding into Inclusive Dance techniques.Feel free to ask me any questionsAll it will take is 200 people contributing $5 each!!
Thank you,Ali

story:
The fan keeps on Spinning 

Help research and production cost for a short dance film 

John Wannehag, founder of En Wannehag Produktion, has been given the chance to spend 12 weeks of research on the subject of "touch". 

The questions John will be asking himself during this time are: 

  • What happens when we leave or let go of another person. 
  • What do we feel? 
  • How does our bodies react? 
  • How does the world around us react? 

It is John's aim that under the 12 weeks of research to develop a new dance film under the project name "The fan keeps on spinning".

About En Wannehag Produktion 

A collective name for performance work, film and general craziness done by John Wannehag. 

Since the beginning of 2014 En Wannehag Produktion has produced 5 short dance films, with Young Angry Men being the most successful one.

Winner of Cinédans Dance on Screen Film festival student category 2015 (NL)

Winner of Northern Artist Film Program award Student chategory 2014 (UK)

"Yet the biggest success lay in the overall official winner of the category; Young Angry Men(John Wannehag) which complimented visual political narrative with emotive choreography. Tackling the label of “young angry men” blamed for the Stockholm riots in 2013, Wannehag contrasts exagerrated displays of agressive machismo with pensive, vulnerable glmipses of the same young man, stripped and alone in a house. It’s a welcome insight and interpretation of the calm before and after the inner storm in these frustrated young men who are often without a considerate voice." Alice Frances aliasTHE411(435)

Inspiration and hopes

The initial idea with the film "The fan keeps on spinning" comes from the newly written poem with the same name. The poem describes the painful event on remembering intimacy, and how the world keeps on moving forward even though we might not.  

The fan keeps on spinning,

silence.

we drank, and drank, we poured, and poured,

we gave our hearts up, exposing every inch of us to each other,

letting our souls collapse and collide as poetry in motion.

The fan keeps on spinning,

silence.

the empty place next to me still smells of you, 

the dried mascara from your tears on my shoulder still burns, 

the sheets still resembles the last time you pressed your body into them,

and the warmth from your kiss still lingers on my chest as a reminder,

we keep on moving, 

the fan keeps on spinning,

you,

you,

you're the only one that knows the words.

What We Need 

The aim of the project is to raise 1942 GBP, which is the total amount required for the research project.

During the 12 weeks John will have access to studios, mentorship and guidance, but more importantly there's time for John to transform the idea into reality. 

In a world where we are becoming more and more disconnected with each other it's important to show that we still are humans. We feel stuff, we want to express stuff and we want to do stuff. 

Contact

If there is anyway you feel you can help this project please feel free to contact me through:
Website
Facebook
or direct johnwannehag@live.se

Thank you

story:
Tafadzwa came to the Dell'Arte International School of Physical Theatre last October as a student in the one-year Professional Training Program.

 Now, in order to accept a scholarship and complete his theatre training, Tafadzwa needs to raise enough money to cover his living expenses in the US for the next two years. As a citizen of Zimbabwe, Tafadzwa is ineligible for traditional financial aid or to work while in the States. Which means he has no foreseeable way to pay for food, rent and utilities for the two years while he is a student!

Because of his exceptional talent as an actor and theatre-maker, and because of the lack of available financial resources in his home country, Tafadzwa Bob Mutumbi of Chitungwiza, Zimbabwe has been awarded Dell'Arte's Merit and Need Advanced International Scholarship, so as to enable him to continue his theatre education at the Dell'Arte. The Scholarship will fund Tafadzwa's tuition in the Advanced Ensemble Program at Dell'Arte for the next two years.  

And this is exactly where you can help!

Please consider making a donation today to Tafadzwa’s Indiegogo campaign for his living expenses during his time in school. Your contribution will be helping a gifted young theatre artist to be able to realize his dream: to develop his own craft as an actor, and to create a performing arts centre in Zimbabwe that will provide free training and will be a place for Zimbabwean artists to nurture their artistic voices.

If you can’t help financially, you can still pitch in by spreading the word. Whether by Facebook, Twitter, email, or word-of-mouth, we would love to see this campaign reach as many people as possible. Thank you for your time!

FAQs

What will Tafdzwa study in his next two years at Dell'Arte?

Dell'Arte International is a theatre school with a resident professional company; it is the North American Center for Ensemble-based Physical Theatre. Building upon foundational studies in physical acting, mask performance, Commedia Dell’Arte, Melodrama, and Clown, Tafadzwa would study character creation, theatrical adaptation, Tragedy, storytelling, community-based theatre, as well as ceremonial dance, mask carving, and shadow puppetry during a one-month residency in Bali.

What is the Advanced Ensemble Program?

Because of the high level of his work in the PTP class, Tafadzwa was invited to join the small group of students moving from the PTP into Dell'Arte's Advanced Ensemble Program, a two-year program for students who do not possess an undergraduate degree but are otherwise qualified for training at the level of MFA students, in terms of talent, rigor, maturity and perspective.   

What will happen if the $10,000 target is not reached?

Sadly, Tafadzwa will have no choice but to withdraw from the Advanced Ensemble Program, as he cannot legally work in the United States nor can he secure private or federal loans. 

What will happen if the $10,000 target is exceeded?

Any funds raised over $10,000 will go into a fund to support Scholarship students at Dell'Arte.

story:
What we're all about:

Second Sight (Johnny Cann & Courtney Harris) is a new theatre collective who will be presenting our premiere performance this summer, inspired by Helen Creighton’s Bluenose Ghosts. Our goal with this project is to explore Nova Scotian life and our rich local histories through traditional music, shadow puppetry, projection, and other modes of storytelling in an attempt to examine folklore, magic, and fear through the lens of our relationship to light and shadow. 
We are fundraising to cover production costs, as well as honorariums for our team of performers and creators. We see this project as a way to strengthen our local cultural consciousness, while exploring methods of storytelling. As emerging Nova Scotian artists, and recent graduates hoping to continue to create meaningful work in our home province, while bringing others into our process. We greatly appreciate any possible contributions to this work and its life!

How you're helping us:

The piece is a performance taking place in multiple rooms, using non-conventional shadow puppetry and projection techniques to create a magical as well as intimate storytelling experience. We are excited to share this piece with the community after roughly a year of development, and two months spent last fall developing portions at the National Theatre School in Montreal under the advisement of puppeteer, designer, and performer, Clea Minaker. 

To create a production of this kind, removed from a traditional theatre space, we will be making fabric/paper screens, building light sources for shadow work, creating costumes/props, and other technical elements. Support from this fundraising drive will help us cover the cost of these materials, along with the hands required to do the work. Our goal is to create a sustainable performance that could be taken to rural communities in the province in the future.

Some perks to donating include:

- A framed print of our 'flagship' image, which was created by local artist, Tyler Hyde

- A recording by the Second Sight members of a Nova Scotian folk song

- A ghost story in the vein of Bluenose Ghosts written about you or your family

- A commissioned shadow show for you or your event by Second Sight Collective

But why?

Through creating this piece, our ultimate goals are to rejuvenate local myths and music and also to explore the idea of fear in the digital age. We see magic in the pages of Helen Creighton’s Bluenose Ghosts, and want to use theatre as a modern platform to justify the relevance of this work that has sometimes been criticized as being anti-modernity.

Our poster image (prints given to donors to be made without text)

Artwork by the extremely talented and generous Tyler Hyde.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to share this campaign with anybody you know who may be interested in helping out!

story:
Breve reseña

adiuvare danza terapia es un proyecto que integra la danza con diferentes técnicas de ayuda psicológica ,con la cual se pretende ayudar a las personas que han sufrido maltratos de forma física y emocionalmente y a personas en riego de calle, queremos formas personas que crean en ellos mismos y tengan una gran autoestima para desarrollar sus capacidades y así poder salir a delante y poder construir una nueva sociedad.

adiuvare dance therapy is a project that integrates dance with different techniques of psychological help, which is to help people who have been abused physically and emotionally and people at risk of street, we ways people believe in themselves and have great self-esteem to develop their skills so they can get ahead and to build a new society.

<計畫概述> 舞蹈療癒計畫是一個藉由”舞蹈”來幫助人們達到心靈療癒的另類心理治療技巧。舞蹈療癒可以協助那些曾經有過受虐經驗(身體或心靈上)或是生活暴露在危險街頭的人們再次得到心靈的平靜。我們希望可以協助人們再次相信自己擁有力量,拾回他們的自我認同,以達到可以發展他們天生擁有的天分去並去創造一個嶄新的社會。

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

queremos recaudar 9000 dolares que servirán en primer lugar para poder tener el espacio rentado en donde dar los talleres y poder acondicionarlo con sillas, mesas ,espejos y todo lo necesario . 

las ayudas serán a través de premios que en este caso serán clases de baile en vídeo desde un monto mínimo y hasta una clase a  través de skype y si vives en Tuxtla Gutierrez podrás tener acceso a clases presenciales.

Los conceptos acá expresados han sido estimados en duración de 10 meses con lo que se pretende cubrir diferentes cosas administrativas luz agua y materiales que salgan de imprevisto.


wewant  raise 9000 dollars to serve first to have rented space where workshops and power to condition it with chairs, tables, mirrors and everything you need.

aid will be through awards in this case will be video dance lessons from a minimum amount and even a class through skype and if you live in Tuxtla Gutierrez will have access to classes.

The concepts here expressed are estimated duration of 10 months which is intended to cover various administrative things light water out of unexpected materials.

<我們所需的資源,以及您將獲得的回報> 我們希望能夠募集9,000美元,主要用來租可以舉辦課程以及辦公的教室,並且還有基本的桌椅,跳舞用的全身鏡等等的基本用品。 只要您贊助這個計畫,根據贊助金額的多寡,我們將致贈舞蹈課程的視頻影片甚至是通過skype的線上舞蹈教室。或是如果您住在Tuxtla Gutierre,也歡迎您來上課! 上述的10個月內需要的粗估內容,並包含一些非預期的細項項目產生。

Concepto

Monto

Renta

4500

Traslado

800

Equipo de sonido

400

Espejos

500

vestuarios

1750

Materiales para talleres

500

Siillas y mesas para talleres

500

Total

8950

El impacto

en nuestro país mexico es muy difícil poder conseguir recursos y sabemos que las personas de buen corazón y que quieren ayudar existen en muchas partes del mundo, por eso recurrimos a ustedes solo ustedes pueden ayudar a que se pueda ayudar a muchas personas solo ustedes pueden hacer el cambio  en esta sociedad.


our mexico country is very difficult to get resources and know people of good heart and who want to help in many parts of the world, therefore we turn to you only you can help it can help many people only you can do the change in this society.


<影響> 在我們的國家-墨西哥,實在非常難取得一些資源或是募得一些好心人的捐款,所以我們希望將這個計畫分享給你,只有你可以幫助我們這麼多人!可以幫忙改變我們的社會!

Riesgos y desafíos

se sabe que el arte es menospreciado por muchas personas que creen que solo puede ser una perdida de tiempo invertirle a este tipo de proyectos, pero podemos decirles que el arte ( la danza) es de muy buena ayuda para muchas personas hemos conocido a mucha gente que han cambiado su vida a través de la danza y si esto lo unimos a la psicología claro que podemos crear un nuevo modelo de auto ayuda para las personas. sera un desafió grande pero podemos lograrlo.


It knows that art is despised by many people who believe it may only be a waste of time invertirle to such projects, but we can say that art (dance) is very good help for many people we met many people who have changed their life through dance and if this is joined the psychology course we can create a new model of self-help for people. It will be a big challenge but we can do it.


<風險以及挑戰> 我們知道有些人也許不是很認同藝術會帶來甚麼影響力,會覺得這個計畫是在浪費時間。但我們可以保證,通過藝術(舞蹈)可以為許多人們帶來很好的影響。實際上我們也遇到了很多人經過舞蹈,徹底改善了他們的生活。這不僅是單純的跳舞,而且這還包含了心理學上的幫助,我們期許創造一個新的模式,協助給予人們自助的力量。我們知道這是一個不簡單的挑戰,但是我們深信我們做得到!

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

si ustedes no pueden ser benefactores por el motivo que sea por lo menos ayudemos a difundirlo con personas que si puedan y quieran ayudar entre mas personas sean mas rápido podremos poner en marcha este gran proyecto comparte comparte comparte.


if you can not be benefactors for whatever reason at least we help to spread to people that if they can and want to help the more people are faster we implement this great project shares shares shares.

<你可以帶來幫助的其他方法> 不論因為任何原因您無法在此刻捐款,但如果您可以幫忙分享這個計劃給你身邊的親友,或是幫我們分享給更多的人!擴散這份訊息,幫助我們可以越快達成這個計畫!非常感謝您!分享~分享~分享~

our mexico country is very difficult to get resources and know people of good heart and who want to help in many parts of the world, therefore we turn to you only you can help it can help many people only you can do the change in this society.

<影響>
在我們的國家-墨西哥,實在非常難取得一些資源或是募得一些好心人的捐款,所以我們希望將這個計畫分享給你,只有你可以幫助我們這麼多人!可以幫忙改變我們的社會!
    Riesgos y desafíos se sabe que el arte es menospreciado por muchas personas que creen que solo puede ser una perdida de tiempo invertirle a este tipo de proyectos, pero podemos decirles que el arte ( la danza) es de muy buena ayuda para muchas personas hemos conocido a mucha gente que han cambiado su vida a través de la danza y si esto lo unimos a la psicología claro que podemos crear un nuevo modelo de auto ayuda para las personas. sera un desafió grande pero podemos lograrlo.

It knows that art is despised by many people who believe it may only be a waste of time invertirle to such projects, but we can say that art (dance) is very good help for many people we met many people who have changed their life through dance and if this is joined the psychology course we can create a new model of self-help for people. It will be a big challenge but we can do it.

<風險以及挑戰>
我們知道有些人也許不是很認同藝術會帶來甚麼影響力,會覺得這個計畫是在浪費時間。但我們可以保證,通過藝術(舞蹈)可以為許多人們帶來很好的影響。實際上我們也遇到了很多人經過舞蹈,徹底改善了他們的生活。這不僅是單純的跳舞,而且這還包含了心理學上的幫助,我們期許創造一個新的模式,協助給予人們自助的力量。我們知道這是一個不簡單的挑戰,但是我們深信我們做得到!
    Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar  si ustedes no pueden ser benefactores por el motivo que sea por lo menos ayudemos a difundirlo con personas que si puedan y quieran ayudar entre mas personas sean mas rápido podremos poner en marcha este gran proyecto comparte comparte comparte.

if you can not be benefactors for whatever reason at least we help to spread to people that if they can and want to help the more people are faster we implement this great project shares shares shares.
<你可以帶來幫助的其他方法>
不論因為任何原因您無法在此刻捐款,但如果您可以幫忙分享這個計劃給你身邊的親友,或是幫我們分享給更多的人!擴散這份訊息,幫助我們可以越快達成這個計畫!非常感謝您!分享~分享~分享~

story:
About Essential and the Festival:

Essential Theatre has been supporting Georgia playwrights and presenting new plays to Atlanta audiences since 1987. Since 2012, the Essential Theatre Play Festival has presented all world premieres by Georgia playwrights. "Our vision in moving forward," says Founding Artistic Director Peter Hardy, "is to give Georgia playwrights an ever-stronger voice across the country and in the world, and in so doing, to continue to enrich our own community of artists and audience members here at home."

Towards that end, we are proud to present you with the seventeenth annual Essential Theatre Play Festival. This year's festival will be taking place July 24 through August 23 at the West End Performing Arts Center (945 Ralph David Abernathy Blvd, Atlanta, GA 30310). We're excited to be returning to West End, and we can't wait to share this year's shows with you:

Lillian Likes It by Joshua Mikel, winner of the 2015 Essential Theatre Playwriting Award (July 31-August 23, World Premiere). A young woman thinks she may have found the perfect guy -- unfortunately, he's dead, but does that really matter if she can still chat with him online? (There's an app for that.) A provocative comedy about the search for human connection in a time where we rarely meet face to face.

The Old Ship of Zion by Natalia Naman (July 24-August 21, Professional World Premiere). A warm, touching play about the members of a small African-American church, struggling to keep its doors open and adapt to changing times. Mama Gwen is a beloved elder who feels the burden of others who depend on the strength of her faith, and Quincy is a young man who loves his church but is beginning to realize that he's gay. About people searching for a spiritual life in trying times. With lots of music!

And of course we will be continuing our Bare Essentials play reading series with open readings of three new plays by Georgia writers. All readings are free and open to the public with discussion and feedback after.

The Impact

Essential Theatre is the longest-running theatre dedicated exclusively to supporting the work of Georgia playwrights. We’ve gained a lot of momentum over the past few years. Help us build on our past success and continue our forward momentum with this summer's festival!
Your donations will help cover the cost of production materials, artist fees and promotion for the festival.

What You Get In Return

Besides the satisfaction of seeing Georgia playwrights' work come to life before your eyes, and besides the pride of knowing you are helping to give Georgia playwrights a voice, check out the great perks we've got in store, listed to the right:

*Want to help your donation dollars go farther? Contact us through the link at the top of the page to let us know you'd like to pick up your mailable perks at the box office when you come to see any show in the Festival! We promise to use the money we save on postage wisely and well.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re interested in helping the Essential Theatre in other ways, read on to find out more:

  • Help us get the word out about our festival and this campaign. Share them with everyone you know! You've heard it in countless curtain speeches, and it's true: your word of mouth is the best tool we have. 
  • Read about other ways you can get involved here. There are lots of ways that you can pitch in to help give Georgia playwrights a voice!

story:
A More Intimate Richard

Some people see an 18x20 foot stage with 41 seats as, perhaps, too small for a somewhat large cast show like Richard III (we have 16 players, many in multiple roles). I see it as an opportunity to present a different kind of production, an intimate encounter with one of Shakespeare's most fascinating anti-heroes. For most of the play, Richard embraces the audience, takes them in his confidence and shares his plans with them with sly humor. In a much larger space, much of that intimacy is lost. Yes, Richard speaks to the audience, but it is difficult to feel that connection.

In thinking about mounting this production, I thought back on the best Richard I have seen, Ian McKellan's brilliant tour with the RSC. I was fortunate enough to be close to the stage and so felt the full force of that powerful performance. I also thought about a production of a show about a differently antiheroic Richard, President Nixon, I saw a number of times at the Odyssey back in 1988. I remember how the actor playing Nixon made me feel like he and I were alone in that little space.

I love the power that intimacy provides to pull the audience in and not let them go and I look forward to sharing this intimate Richard of Gloucester with audiences at ECT.

Quid Pro Quo

So we do need money to make this work. We've already raised close to $2,000, which will certainly get us off the ground. But we need more and that's where you come in. We need an additional $5,000 to support designers in crafting the highest quality costumes and sets. We need the money to assist in our PR campaign to ensure our marvelous performers have the greatest number of people come and see them. None of these things are free. Everything costs and should we not raise the money here, I'll be Ubering for production cash. 

Please help me not Uber and in return you'll get programs mentions and free tickets and one of these nifty candles.

If you give us a lot of money, we'll cook you an amazing dinner and make a movie of it!
And you get a write off...we're a 501c3.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is sometimes hard to come by, but we can use your help spreading the word about this campaign and the show. If you refer 5 folks to this campaign, You'll get a "buy-on-get-one-free" ticket to the show.

story:
MY STORY

My name is Cassandra Newman and I am an actress, a writer and the producer of Arise, Baltimore!   

Inspired by arguments I had with friends during the riots, I decided to combine the training I received for my Master's in Peace and Conflict Resolution from American University with my dramatic pursuits.  I created Arise, Baltimore! as a means of using theater to open pathways of dialogue and empathy within the Baltimore community. 

The purpose of my festival is to challenge the average playwright, both young and old, black and white, to craft ten-minute plays that not only address the underlying causes of the tension affecting our country right now, but contain solutions to promote reconciliation in Baltimore and our nation as a whole.  We know what the problems are --- racial profiling, economic deprivation, lack of opportunity, etc.  I want to hear answers!

THE BUDGET

I would like to use the Recital Hall at Morgan State University's Murphy Fine Arts Center, a performance venue with a long history of presenting entertaining productions that reach out to all communities.

Here's my budget breakdown:

Licensing Fee for the Recital Hall:  $1,500.00 (for Priority V use)
Rehearsal Fee for 2 Days of Rehearsal:  $1,000.00
Lighting Director:  $280.00
Box Office Staff:  $88.00 (for 2 people, for 2 hours prior to performance)
Police Officers:  $210.00 (for 2 officers, during a three-hour performance)
Actors and Playwrights:  $1,440 ($96 stipends for 7 performers and 8 playwrights)
Music Stands:  $35.00 (for 7 performers)
Chairs:  $31.50 (for 7 performers)
Publicity and Promotion:  $500.00
Contingencies:  $510.00

As such, I would need $5,594.50 to make this festival happen (Indiegogo makes you round up). 

IMPACT

I believe that the power of art can inspire new leaders and help change the world.  It is my hope that this festival will reach many young people and galvanize them into leading lives devoted to social justice and conflict resolution.  I want to create a new tradition of dialogue and understanding through art.

On a professional level, I also believe Arise, Baltimore! will give new opportunities for expression to playwrights and actors in the Baltimore-D.C. Metropolitan community.  As such, I am not having an entry fee for playwrights to enter their plays into my competition. 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

If you know anyone who would be interested in submitting a play, please refer them to bigegoproductions.weebly.com/arise-baltimore.html and please spread the word!

story:
Each of us has a purpose. And we believe that each person on earth was created with specific design and intention by our perfect Maker. We've been amazed by and blessed to discover artists throughout California, across the nation, and all over the world that have the same mission as ourselves: to use our God-given gifts of dance, music, song, and the arts to glorify our ultimate Creator. 

We are committed to making Project Light happen in order to spread the impact God has already done and continues to do through the arts to remind each other of the reason why we perform in the first place, to encourage and spur one another on to see how we and others are all making an impact for His Kingdom, and to testify to all that God touches and softens people's hearts in such a way that could only be described as an amazing encounter with Love.

Our current founding team is composed of members and directors of sister dance ministry teams Agape from UC Davis and Abba Modern from UC Berkeley. We cannot wait to see what new friendships, partnerships, and transformations Project Light will bring!

We invite you to be a part of a one-of-a-kind event that is bringing together performers who want their audiences to know Christ! 

The purpose of our showcase is...

  • To unify Christian performers in mutual support upon seeing a bigger picture of what God is doing in performance culture to spread His love and strengthen His Kingdom.

  • To reawaken the reason behind why we dance, play music, or use any of our abilities for Him, and to reignite our hearts to work towards more, together.

  • To encourage Christian performers to continue drawing inspiration from Christ, and to remind the arts community that stewarding our gifts, time, and resources to help the world become better is a greater gift than winning titles or accolades.

  • To showcase the talents God has placed in performers, and to share the impact Jesus has made within all of us through these gifts.

  • To reveal a glimpse of God’s Kingdom to audiences by inspiring, emboldening, and providing community to other Christian artists who can mobilize in their own cities and use their talents for Him.

  • To project His Light, His Love, & His Truth!


Join us on April 30th, 2016 at the Palace of Fine Arts, SF. 

  1. Purchase your ticket now with our "Candle" perk! 100% of proceeds go into making this showcase happen, including costs for:

    Our estimated total cost is $16,000. This campaign is aiming for only half of that, as we are also reaching out to local churches and communities for offline sponsorships. 
    • All profits will be donated to New Day for Children, a faith-based non-profit organization that seeks to recover children caught in the despair of child sex trafficking and to restore their stolen childhoods.
  2. Apply to perform! We are still looking for Christ-centered performing artists to be in our lineup. 
    • In return, you are invited to participate in a special fellowship time before the showcase during which all performers will get to share and learn about how God has been moving in each other's work, complimentary food, and the priceless experience of being part of a unique showcase in unity with other Christian artists!
    • Click here to apply!
  3. Apply to join our team!
    • In return, receive an extraordinary experience of being a part of making this showcase happen. Learn and strengthen valuable skills to add to your professional development and yes, your résumé. Not to mention, you'll also befriend and work with an awesome team of Christ-honoring, logistics-loving people who share a vision and passion of bringing this event to life and sharing God's truth and love with the world!
    • Fill out the volunteer form here!

LINEUP

You will NOT want to miss the inspiration of 
Tim Be Told
Lyrical Opposition
Abba Modern
Agape
The Recipe Dance Company
Sodium Dance Company
Avy & The Factory
(EN)Light 
and more! Check out the gallery for photos and videos, and stay tuned for updates :)

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  1. Please pray for us, the showcase, and all artists and creators around the world to use their God-given talents for God Himself!
  2. Please share this campaign with your friends—we need all the help we can get in spreading the world and raising enough funds to make this event happen.
  3. Lastly, please follow/"like" us on social media, and share with them/invite your friends to follow us, too! Again, we are relying heavily on word-of-mouth to get all the support that we can, as well as to sell tickets for the showcase itself!
FACEBOOK | WEBSITE (coming soon!)


T-SHIRT

For the LIGHTBULB perk:


FAQ / TL;DR

What is Project Light?

A performing arts showcase scheduled for April 30, 2016 at SF's Palace of the Fine Arts. What's special about this, however, is that it's Christ-centered with a vision to unite and celebrate Christian performing artists in one house for one night (hopefully this can become an annual thing, but we're starting small for now!). We aim to change the culture around us to point people toward God. And all proceeds go to the Christian anti-sex trafficking organization, New Day for Children. 

Who is supporting Project Light?

Jesus! We want to use our God-given gifts of dance, music, and the arts to glorify our Creator. 

Project Light team. The team is a general partnership of individuals, either current students or alum of UC Berkeley and UC Davis, who have encountered God in the performing arts. 

Lineup. We’re still working on a finalized list of performers, but we’ve confirmed Christ-centered dance teams, Agape from UC Davis and Abba Modern from UC Berkeley, who seek to be a light in their respective campus dance communities. Fun dance team the Recipe Dance Company is in the lineup as well! We have also confirmed amazing, soulful vocalist and band, Tim Be Told, and Lyrical Opposition, a Missional Art Collective that focuses on bringing positivity, diversity, and unity into different communities through creating positive arts and events. We are currently communicating with other performers and artist groups, so stay tuned for that!

What do you need?

Prayer!! This is a showcase for God and through it we want to glorify His name and project His light! We want to keep our hopes and gazes on the Lord. 

Financial partnership. We need to raise more than $24,000 by the end of March to cover costs for venue, artists' honoraria, merchandise, ticketing services, hospitality and publicity materials, etc. We're asking churches, organizations, and businesses to donate around $2,000. Feel free to give more or less—any donation is helpful! 

Promotion. We’re excited to invite as many people as possible to the showcase, so it would be AWESOME if you could share the word about the event with friends and family (and come yourself!).

It would be an honor to spiritually and/or financially partner with you!

What's the impact of Project Light?

Jesus inspires us to grow the kingdom in new ways, and to reach the youth in a language that encourages them to expand their faith through creative expression and worship with every part of their being (Psalm 149). Thus, we're inviting youth and young adults from across the Bay Area to ignite their passion by attending, performing, or partnering with Project Light. We're sure the experience will be a new and refreshing way to engage with Jesus and community.

What can we do?

Donate to this Indiegogo campaign! Apply to perform! Apply to join our team! Spread the word and pray for us :)

How do I purchase multiple tickets?

Since the Candle perk purchases you 1 ticket, select Two Candles for 2 tickets, Three Candles for 3 tickets, and so on!


BE PART OF PROJECT LIGHT

With dancers and musicians alike, we can't wait to showcase pieces that will express the true star of the night—Jesus Christ—for whom we perform and live.

We eagerly invite you to join us in experiencing the power of creative expression in embodying, sharing, and projecting Jesus' love and what He has already done for all who seek Him.

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to contact us!

  • FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/projectlight.dance
  • ADMIN EMAIL: projectlight.dance@gmail.com
  • FUNDRAISING EMAIL: projectlight.fundraising@gmail.com

FAQ / TL;DR







What is Project Light?A performing arts showcase scheduled for April 30, 2016 at SF's Palace of the Fine Arts. What's special about this, however, is that it's Christ-centered with a vision to unite and celebrate Christian performing artists in one house for one night (hopefully this can become an annual thing, but we're starting small for now!). We aim to change the culture around us to point people toward God. And all proceeds go to the Christian anti-sex trafficking organization, New Day for Children. 
Who is supporting Project Light?Jesus! We want to use our God-given gifts of dance, music, and the arts to glorify our Creator. 
Project Light team. The team is a general partnership of individuals, either current students or alum of UC Berkeley and UC Davis, who have encountered God in the performing arts. 
Lineup. We’re still working on a finalized list of performers, but we’ve confirmed Christ-centered dance teams, Agape from UC Davis and Abba Modern from UC Berkeley, who seek to be a light in their respective campus dance communities. Fun dance team the Recipe Dance Company is in the lineup as well! We have also confirmed amazing, soulful vocalist and band, Tim Be Told, and Lyrical Opposition, a Missional Art Collective that focuses on bringing positivity, diversity, and unity into different communities through creating positive arts and events. We are currently communicating with other performers and artist groups, so stay tuned for that!
What do you need?Prayer!! This is a showcase for God and through it we want to glorify His name and project His light! We want to keep our hopes and gazes on the Lord. 

Financial partnership. We need to raise more than $24,000 by the end of March to cover costs for venue, artists' honoraria, merchandise, ticketing services, hospitality and publicity materials, etc. We're asking churches, organizations, and businesses to donate around $2,000. Feel free to give more or less—any donation is helpful! 
Promotion. We’re excited to invite as many people as possible to the showcase, so it would be AWESOME if you could share the word about the event with friends and family (and come yourself!).
It would be an honor to spiritually and/or financially partner with you!
What's the impact of Project Light?Jesus inspires us to grow the kingdom in new ways, and to reach the youth in a language that encourages them to expand their faith through creative expression and worship with every part of their being (Psalm 149). Thus, we're inviting youth and young adults from across the Bay Area to ignite their passion by attending, performing, or partnering with Project Light. We're sure the experience will be a new and refreshing way to engage with Jesus and community.

What can we do?Donate to this Indiegogo campaign! Apply to perform! Apply to join our team! Spread the word and pray for us :)
How do I purchase multiple tickets?Since the Candle perk purchases you 1 ticket, select Two Candles for 2 tickets, Three Candles for 3 tickets, and so on!
 


 BE PART OF PROJECT LIGHT


With dancers and musicians alike, we can't wait to showcase pieces that will express the true star of the night—Jesus Christ—for whom we perform and live.

We eagerly invite you to join us in experiencing the power of creative expression in embodying, sharing, and projecting Jesus' love and what He has already done for all who seek Him.

If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to contact us!


FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/projectlight.dance


ADMIN EMAIL: projectlight.dance@gmail.com


FUNDRAISING EMAIL: projectlight.fundraising@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

This event is aiming to be a venue for artists from all over the world and Irish artists alike to come together and celebrate our fusion of cultures and collaborate in multiple artistic fields such as: Music, Visual arts Theatre and Circus.

We aim in the process to also raise funds in order to keep providing workshops and train the trainer sessions in developing countries and therefore allow the little seed of art to spread.

The event date would be the weekend of the 22-24th of April.


What We Need & What You Get

We need to hire:

- A venue where we would be able to camp on the premises for two nights.

- 2 tents for music and workshops

- A smaller tipi tent to run Jam sessions

- Stages and sound systems

- Generators

- Toilets

- Security

- Vans to transport art, instruments and artists

We will have:

- Traders of food and arts and crafts from different parts of the world

- Art and decorations installed in the tents and surrounding area.

In more detail:

The size of the event depends on the help and funding we raise.

The first aim is to get people together, keep them dry, warm, happy and creative.

Give a chance to artist and arts lovers to meet and appreciate each other.

The Impact

Your contribution will make this happen. There are never enough venues for people to come together. Moreover once the costs are covered the event aim is to raise founds for charities such as: 

Join Hands Talent Africa JOHATA https://www.facebook.com/JOIN-HANDS-Talent-Africa-741909625913724/

A Ugandan charity that aims to give children and youth a venue to express their artistic and sport talent.

Risks & Challenges

The main risk is that we won't be able to cover the costs and therefore we might fail in the fundraiser side of the event. The challenge is in knowing that this might happen but believing it won't.

Other Ways You Can Help

If money is tight and you can't part with any penny at the moment we understand!

- You can contact us at rrathergather@gmail.com and volunteer with us. Donate your time and skills instead!

- You can share and ask your wealthy friends to part with few bobs for us.

- You can ask Santa to send us some funds for Christmas!

Remember them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

Α cultural project that emerges arts, tangible cultural heritage and social awareness on equality issues

Drops of Breath is the first underwater dance performance in the world. First that was presented on September 25th 2015 at Cape Sounio, Attica, Greece. 15 performers 3 of them disabled and 3 of them children, from France, Greece and Cyprus, took part in a unique experience under the ancient temple of Poseidon. The audience had the option to view the performance in three different ways: scuba diving, snorkeling over the set or from a large projection on the coast.

It was more than just a performance, it was artistry in its purest form and an immersive experience that its purpose was to boast the ideals of true diversity in the realm of dance. The weightlessness of submersion allowed those with disabilities to embrace their "inner mermaid" and express themselves in ways that could never be possible on land.

The creative artist set behind Drops of Breath prides itself on the ideal of being multi-disciplinary, going far beyond defending peoples' differences and the fact to work on the exploration of humanity's similarities, highlights the values of sharing, acceptance of the Other and empathy.

It really was one of the most surreal art experience that one could imagine!

Our dream came true this September, now our vision is to continue this dream worldwide.

We want to continue. Support us.


What We Need & What You Get

HELP US to reach our goal

• If we reach the amount of 10,000 €, we will be able to finalize the project's financial  obligations "Drops of Breath" selected by European Culture (Creative Culture 2020 program) so far all participants (dancers, instructors , photographers) and continue diving training for next season.

• If we manage to reach 20,000 €, we can continue our diving training for the next Drops of Breath season and consider a tour in several cities around the Mediterranean.

• If we manage to reach 30,000€, we can plan to travel our performance in the US

Deductibility of taxes  to be checked according to the country


They said about us

Diving Audience Review

“It was a unique experience. As a diver I know the difficulties of floating and I want to say that the dancers – divers were excellent at this very difficult enterprise”

“I had diving lessons only to be able to watch this performance. It

was an experience and a life lesson”

“I was impressed by the fidelity of the underwater sound. Its volume was tuned to the ideal level and it could convey all the enchantment of performance.”

“ An –once in a lifetime experience-I came to Greece from Mexico with my wife just to live a myth !”

Snorkeling audience review

“The panoramic view was impressive, I felt as if I were in another planet!” “It is an amazing experience to be able to float and at the same time listen to a wonderful music and watch the dancers”

“I am speechless , I was always dreaming to go to another planet ,couldn’t imagine that this planet is underwater!”

Screen audience review

“I was so moved seeing the dancers with their very heavy equipment passing next to us before diving in the water. A bit later, as I was watching them on the screen, dancing freely and weightless, I also felt light and free as if I

could fly!”

«”A wonderful video, a sensitive and very artistic choreography”

“Excellent choreography ! My kids saw the creation of the world in 40’! They loved it –we are going to learn diving to be underwater the next time


Contributors

Concept / Choreography: Apostolia Papadamaki - Sophie Bulbulyan

Underwater Music: Trifon Koutsourelis

Underwater set design / costumes: George Georgiou

Underwater filmography: Anastasis Agathos

Diving instructors: Luc Lakeman, Tasos Papapanos

Performers

Nefeli Boiskoiti, Jules Bulbulyan, Sophie Bulbulyan, Souad Daoudi, Eleni Diamanti, Anton Kessler, Irini Kourouvani, Thierry Maboang, , Αristotelis Marinopoulos, Apostolia Papadamaki,  Τasos Papapanos, Christina Patsali, Michée Quenum, Antonis Strouzas, Dimitra Svigou

* Collaborating countries: Cyprus, France, Greece, Hungary, Lebanon, The Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Sweden.


Partners

Creative Europe Horizon 2020 is co-funding the project,  which received many institutionnal organizations supports from Greece, France and Cyprus.

Official Airline Carrier for "Drops of Breath" is AEGEAN and Official Vehicle Sponsor is OPEL 

*Drops of Breath is part of "The Underwater Heart of the Mediterranean"- a polymorphic project with the support of European Union, Creative Europe, Horizon 2020 program for the period January 2015-February 2016 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Français

Drops of Breath –

Le premier spectacle  chorégraphique  sous-marin

"We are all one"

Un projet culturel qui réunit les Arts, le patrimoine culturel et la conscience sociale

sur les questions d'égalité.

Drops of Breath est le premier spectacle de danse sous-marine au monde qui a été présenté le 25 Septembre 2015 au Cap Sounion, dans la Région Attique, en Grèce. 15 interprètes dont 3 en situation de handicap et 3 enfants, venant de France, de Grèce et de Chypre, ont pris part à une expérience unique sous l'ancien temple de Poséidon. Le public a eu la possibilité de voir le spectacle de trois manières différentes: en plongée sous-marine à 5 mètres de profondeur, ou en surface avec masque et tuba, ou sur grand écran sur la plage.

Cela a été plus qu’une performance; c’est l'Art dans sa forme la plus pure et une expérience immersive qui a pour but de mettre en avant les idéaux de la diversité. L’immersion a permis aux personnes handicapées d’embrasser leur "sirène intérieure" et de s’ exprimer d'une manière qui est pour eux impossible sur terre.

Le désir de travailler sur l'exploration des similitudes de l'Humanité met en évidence des valeurs de partage, d’acceptation de l’Autre et d’empathie.

C’est vraiment l’ expérience artistique la plus surréaliste que l'on pourrait imaginer!

Notre rêve est devenu réalité en Septembre dernier, maintenant notre vision est de continuer ce rêve dans le monde entier!

Nous voulons continuer! Soutenez-nous


AIDEZ-NOUS pour atteindre notre objectif

• Si nous atteignons le montant de  € 10,000, nous serons en mesure de finaliser les obligations financières du projet “Drops of Breath” sélectionné par la Culture Européénne( Creative Culture program Horizon 2020 ) jusqu’à présent à tous les participants (danseurs, instructeurs, photographes) et de poursuivre la formation de plongée pour la saison prochaine.

• Si nous parvenons à € 20,000, nous pouvons poursuivre la formation de plongée pour la prochaine saison de Drops of Breath et envisager une  tournée dans plusieurs villes autour de la Méditerranée.

• Si nous parvenons à € 30,000, nous pouvons planifier de faire voyager notre performance aux Etats-Unis

Reçus fiscaux disponibles sur demande. Déductibilité fiscale à vérifier selon votre pays

On parle de nous

Des retours de la part des plongeurs:

«Ce fut une expérience unique. En tant que plongeur, je connais la difficulté de flottabilité et je tiens à dire que les danseurs - plongeurs étaient excellents dans cette entreprise très difficile "

«J’ai simplement appris à plonger pour pouvoir regarder cette performance. C’était une expérience unique et une leçon de vie "

"Je suis impressionné par la fidélité du son sous l'eau. Son volume a été réglé sur le niveau idéal et il a pu retransmettre toute la magie de la performance. "

"L’expérience d’une vie, je suis venu en Grèce du Mexique avec ma femme qui vient de vivre un mythe!"

Vu de la surface:

"La vue panoramique est impressionnante, je sentais comme si j’étais sur une autre planète!" "C’ est une expérience incroyable d'être en mesure de flotter et en même temps écouter une musique merveilleuse et regarder les danseurs"

«Je suis sans voix, j’ai toujours rêvé d'aller sur une autre planète, je ne pouvais pas imaginer que cette planète était sous l'eau!"

Le ressenti du public devant l’écran :

«Je suis tellement ému de voir les danseurs avec leur équipement très lourd en passant à côté de nous avant de plonger dans l'eau. En  les regardant sur l'écran un peu plus tard, danser librement et en apesanteur, je me suis senti aussi libre et léger, comme si je pouvais voler! "

" Une merveilleuse vidéo, une chorégraphie sensible et très artistique "

"Excellent chorégraphie! Mes enfants ont vu la création du monde en 40 '! Ils ont adoré  - Nous allons apprendre la plongée sous-marine pour être sous l’eau  la prochaine fois »


En collaboration

Concept / Chorégraphie:Apostolia Papadamaki - Sophie Bulbulyan

Création musicale sous-marine : Trifon Koutsourelis

Scénographie et création Costumes: George Georgiou

Conseiller technique plongée sous-marine: Tasos Papapanos, Luc Lakeman

Tournage sous-marin: Anastasis Agathos

Les Danseurs

Nefeli Boiskoiti, Jules Bulbulyan, Sophie Bulbulyan, Souad Daoudi, Eleni Diamanti, Anton Kessler, Irini Kourouvani, Thierry Maboang, , Αristotelis Marinopoulos, Apostolia Papadamaki,  Τasos Papapanos, Christina Patsali, Michée Quenum, Antonis Strouzas, Dimitra Svigou

*Pays en collaboration: Chypre, Espagne, France, Grèce, Hongrie, Les Pays-Bas, Liban, Portugal, Suède.


Partenaires

Le programme Creative Europe Horizon 2020 co-finance le projet qui a été soutenu par de nombreuses organisations institutionnelles de Grèce, France et Chypre.

Le transporteur aérien officiel est AEGEAN et le sponsor officiel pour les véhivules est OPEL

*Drops of Breath fait partie de "The Underwater Heart of the Mediterranean"- un projet supporté par l’Union Européenne Union, Creative Europe, Horizon 2020 programme pour la  période de  Janvier 2015 à Février 2016


Drops of Breath in the Media /Drops of Breath dans la presse internationale 

THE HUFFINGTON POST

 http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/nik-thakkar/drops-of-breath-immersive- art_b_8203444.html

FRANCE 3

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VdBZNjjRBAU

BFM TV.COM

http://www.bfmtv.com/mediaplayer/video/le-premier-spectacle-aquatique-de-danseurs- handicapes-en-grece-644672.html

FOX34.COM

http://www.fox34.com/story/30115982/dancers-become-divers-for-full-underwater- performance#

MASHABLE 

https://www.facebook.com/permalink.php?story_fbid=962402853801048&id=847453878629280

LONELY PLANET 

http://www.lonelyplanet.com/news/2015/06/10/greece-to-host-worlds-first-underwater-dance-visual-performance/

EURONEWS.COM

http://gr.euronews.com/2015/09/23/prwti-ypovrixia-xoreutiki-parastasi-sto-sounio- drops-of-breath/

HELVETICA

http://edm.com/articles/2015-11-02/diving-dancers

story:
Who Mourns for Bob the Goon?

...is a new play developed by Joshua Young (Playwright) and Lucia Bellini (Director).  It's a black comedy that tells the story of a man who believes he's the obscure comic book character 'Bob the Goon,' a loyal Joker henchman from the Batman comics.  The audience follows Bob as he attends a special therapy group for individuals who all think they are, or were, third tier comic book characters.  

Bob starts to unravel after a new woman is admitted into the group who believes she's from an anime, not a comic.   It's the inaugural production of The Playwriting Collective, founded by Joshua Young, Lu Bellini, and Phillip Christian.


Why is this project special?

This play has a much deeper resonance beyond being about folks who think they were comic book characters... most of the characters in the show are vets from the Iraq and Afghanistan Wars suffering from PTSD and searching for a way to alleviate their mental trauma.  


The creators deeply believe that this piece is -above all- entertaining and a great play.  We don't believe it's an "issue play" at all... but at it's heart it has a somber and important message about how we fail to mourn and often overlook people whose lives impact us the most.  And we strongly believe the play isn't alienating politically, but rather promotes a message that speaks to everyone's sense of sympathy and conscious.


This show will premiere at the HERE Arts Center on July 9th and run through August 14th as part of their SubletSeries.  We're raising funds to adequately prepare this show for its full run as well as raise awareness of our new company and its social message; The Playwriting Collective is a new theater company aimed at giving voice to artists from lower economic backgrounds.

It's important to present to the world a piece of theater that isn't cheap and that has just as much care and attention put into executing the production as was put into the genesis and incubation of the show.  More importantly, as working artists, The Playwriting Collective believes in paying its collaborators.  We're working to change the standard of production to always include fair compensation for the participants and pay artists for their efforts  as qualified, diligent theatrical professionals.

This is only one piece of the puzzle...

... at $50,000.  We have a big show.  We have a cast of 8 people, as well as a full crew and production team.  Furthermore our show has production elements that stretch beyond a shoe string budget.  The characters explore their past as the play switches from their realistic lives and settings to the fantastical comic book realms they think they inhabit.  


To realize this element the show is using a combination of animations, projection, and projection mapping.  

(Below is one of the examples of our interactive, projected sets.)


In the fantasy realms, several characters also appear as a facsimile of their comic-book counterparts, and we want to give the audience the joy of seeing proper costumes not just cosplay.

(Above, pictures from our 10/31/15 Dixon Place showcase production as part of their Works-In-Progress series.)

We're happy to email anyone interested in theatre production a copy of the budget and the line items illustrating exactly where funding goes.  In doing so we hope the contributor would see how this $50,000 is but a portion of the total funds we're attempting to raise.  All contributions are tax deductible as this is the inaugural production of The Playwriting Collective, an official 501c3.

As for what you get...

  • $25+ A special thanks in program
  • $50+ A comic book

  • $100+ Invitation to attend the private invited dress of Who Mourns for Bob the Goon?

  • $250+ A comic book of your choice, Comic book, anime, or manga poster/mini poster (good to fair condition), One ticket to any performance of Who Mourns for Bob the Goon? 

  • $500+ Special Edition comic of your choice (Batman, Superman, X-Men, Sandman, etc...), Comic book, anime, or manga poster/mini poster (good to fair condition), Two tickets to any performance of Who Mourns for Bob the Goon?

  • $1000+ Special Edition comic(s) of your choice (Batman, Superman, X-Men, Sandman, etc...), Special Edition Poster (Mint or great condition), Two tickets to any performance of Who Mourns for Bob the Goon?

  • $10,000+ A Producer Credit, Lifetime Free Admittance to any Playwriting Collective show or production, Special Edition comic(s) of your choice (Batman, Superman, X-Men, Sandman, etc...), Special Edition Poster (Mint or great condition)

  • $50,000+ A Producer Credit, Lifetime Free Admittance to any Playwriting Collective show or production, a full size authentic Iron Man poster from the 2008 film, and a limited edition Justice League comic signed by Jim Lee and Geoff Johns and a limited edition Flashpoint comic signed by Geoff Johns.


Why back us?

Beyond just supporting Who Mourns for Bob the Goon? a donation is supporting The Playwriting Collective.  You can read about our launch here!

The Playwriting Collective, founded by Joshua Young, Lu Bellini, and Phillip Christian (all core members of Who Mourns for Bob the Goon?) formed this production company aimed at raising up voices from lower class backgrounds.  Specifically, The Collective is playwright driven, with a goal to finance and produce new works that support playwrights from poor economic environments and other marginalized communities.

(Pictured above, the Creative Directors of The Playwriting Collective:  Joshua Young, Lu Bellini, and Phillip Christian.)

The Collective's central premise contends that voices from poverty and lower class backgrounds seem to be continually underrepresented in the modern American theater landscape. As a group, The Collective aims to even the playing field against a system that gives an inherent advantage to artists from upper and middle class backgrounds. Central to this cause is an inclusive effort to support playwrights from lower economic backgrounds as well as bring life to new works populated with characters from poor communities.

Each year, The Playwriting Collective will be giving out a $1,000 grant to an unknown, likely first-time, impoverished playwright and provide that writer with an opportunity to have their work developed and performed. The grant will be in combination with a full season's worth of programming; a reading series, an inclusive and rotating writers group, and at least one large scale production a year.

Who Mourns for Bob the Goon? is our first large scale production, and its success means the success for a company that will unilaterally change the types of theater being supported in the modern theater landscape.

We want to do quality work.  We've challenged ourselves to make sure our work goes through a deep process of script analysis, revision, and scrutiny.  We want to make theater that we believe in but that you can attend and have an unambiguously unique and wonderful experience.  We find the balance to push our work while maintaining other funding and dayjob salaries... and the challenge is to make sure you don't come see something that is underdeveloped, unprofessional, or worst of all boring.

We want you to feel like you're getting involved in the creation of a new work by contributing to this show.  The line of communication is open with us.  Please, talk to us, and let us know your thoughts.

If you can't contribute...

Talk to us!  Write us!  Let us know your thoughts about our work or anything else.  And if you downright can't afford it right now, then please come see the work.  Look into the types of work we're doing... look at our mission statements... our past and future shows...
We want to make work that is for you more than anything else!
And remember, all donations are tax deductible as The Playwriting Collective is a recognized 501c3!
