story:
Short Summary

‘Yes!  Shakespeare’ is an original piece of music theatre conceived by two educators who have created 'It's Happening Theatre Productions' (a not-for-profit theatre company) and have met the challenge of making Shakespeare relevant to today’s youth.  The play follows three grade 9 students through the Shakespeare class from hell.  As the three students struggle to meet impossible deadlines and expectations set by their eccentric teacher they develop strong friendships, first love, and a faux love triangle.  The faux love triangle is but one of the parallels to the tales of the Bard they encounter throughout the play.  The family relationship themes found in ‘Hamlet’, ‘King Lear’, ’Romeo & Juliet’, and ‘Taming of the Shrew’ present themselves throughout the play.  Adding to the traffic of the stage are the characters of Shakespeare who present themselves after breaking through the metaphysical barriers of the imaginations of our three central characters.  Shakespeare’s most famous scenes will receive a fresh treatment designed to reinforce their relevance to today’s culture.  Just to add another layer, an 8-piece pit band will drive both modern and Shakespearean characters to tell their stories through an original score of Rock, Reggae, Vaudeville, Soul, and Funk music.  Audiences will fall in love with the characters, sing their way out of the theatre,  and then try to impress whoever they went to the theatre with, by pointing out all the clever parallels and theatrical devices they picked up throughout the evening.

‘Yes! Shakespeare’ will involve a cast of 20-25 Guelph performers.  The primary setting of the play is a high school classroom making the majority of the cast teenagers.  There are parents, and teachers, and King Lears who will be played by adults. The combination of semi-professional adult performers with a strong collection of aspiring performers will create an exciting cast dynamic.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our intention is the 'Yes! Shakespeare' will be staged at The River Run Centre in Guelph.  'Yes! Shakespeare' began organically one day in the school staff room while trying to create a school musical.  Within 5 months, we wrote the script and mounted the show, featuring a total of 6 performances which exceeded our expectations.  The 12 and 13 year old amateurs performing their hearts out inspired us and our audience to the potential of the script. 

We need your help bringing this artistic endeavour to audiences at a professional level. The River Run Centre is a beautiful theatre in downtown Guelph and is the hosting venue for world class performers, comedians, and singers.  Due to the costs of performing at the River Run Centre, it is rare for Guelph performers to bring their own material to grace the stage of the town’s finest performance hall.  This would prove to the theatre community in Guelph that the names on the most prestigious marquee in town can be local.  Our Guelph audience will see that the local  product is worthy of being on this stage and inspire other Guelph directors, writers and performers to play at this venue.  

The Impact

The greatest challenge of ‘Yes! Shakespeare’ is to present the most performed playwright in history through a fresh lens.  We present the importance of timeless classics without repeating interpretations that have been done countless times.  As English, Drama, and Music educators, teaching hundreds of students to wrap their heads around Shakespeare for the first time has given us a unique perspective.  Teenagers develop a greater understanding of Shakespeare when they allow the material to interact with everything else floating within their consciousness, such as their friends, families, pressures, crushes, and their music.  This interaction is impossible without imagination. It is the  imagination of the three central characters of ‘Yes! Shakespeare’ that sees Romeo sing like Jerry Lee Lewis, turns a family dinner into King Lear dividing up his estate, and has Lady Macbeth welcome you to her guilt-ridden hell.

Risks & Challenges

'Yes! Shakespeare' has been an 8 year labour of love; setting out to bring this to a professional stage has produced several artistic challenges including writing an original score, editing the script, recruiting the cast, and securing rehearsal space.  Those artistic challenges have all been overcome - the theatre is booked for a week's run in February of 2016.  The only remaining hurdle is financing the production.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love for you to support the show financially here on indiegogo.com, but if you cannot, then please pass this along to other theatre-enthusiasts via any and all forms of social media or buy a ticket to the show!

Shakespeare' has been an 8 year labour of love; setting out to bring this to a professional stage has produced several artistic challenges including writing an original score, editing the script, recruiting the cast, and securing rehearsal space.  Those artistic challenges have all been overcome - the theatre is booked for a week's run in February of 2016.  The only remaining hurdle is financing the production.
    Other Ways You Can Help We would love for you to support the show financially here on indiegogo.com, but if you cannot, then please pass this along to other theatre-enthusiasts via any and all forms of social media or buy a ticket to the show!

story:
A Musical About Hot Dogs!?

Absolutely. Hot Diggity! tells the story of competitive eater Bud Broman who risks everything for a chance to become the hot dog eating champion of the world. Set on the morning of July 4th at the Nathan's Famous International Hot Dog Eating Contest in Coney Island, this original musical follows Bud as he battles heart disease, a spiteful sportscaster, defending champion Johnny Peanut, and a girlfriend who'd rather he just find a normal job and settle down. Hot Diggity! is about the goals we all set for ourselves, as sportsmen, businessmen, artists, as people -- and the sacrifices we make to achieve them.

The History

As a student at the Eastman School of Music, I was surrounded by musicians who all felt a powerful connection to their craft. But they not only wrestled with demanding schedules and a competitive industry, they had to answer difficult questions such as: What is it worth? Why do I spend eight hours a day in a practice room? Will I be successful? What does the word "success" even mean?

Anyone who is the least bit career-driven asks him- or herself these questions. As a composer, I find myself plagued by them. A few years ago, I decided to retaliate. I decided to write a musical that parodies these feelings by portraying a man who is fiercely devoted to his craft, his art, his passion -- which just so happens to be eating hot dogs.

The Dream

As you may know, it takes a long time to transfer new musicals from the page to the stage. As of now, I've been working on the show for three years. It was just workshopped by the Music Box Theater in Houston, Texas and is finally ready for the next step: submission to festivals and theaters in New York and around the country.

There are many opportunities for new playwrights to have their works read, workshopped, and performed. However, these opportunities require that you submit a demo CD. With your financial support, we can put together that recording and bring this musical to a larger audience!

The Plan

Your contributions will go directly to producing a demo CD. The costs of creating such a CD are numerous. They include:

1: Studio time

2: Mastering time

3: Materials, such as CDs, labels and packaging

4: Compensation for the actors

5: Compensation for the pianist

6: Submission fees

This Indiegogo campaign is limited to just producing the CD. But that's not the end of the journey. I'll send that CD, along with copies of the script, to several festivals around the country, including The New York Musical Theater Festival and The PiTCH at the Finger Lakes Musical Theater Festival. I'll also submit it to various theaters, including The Vineyard and Playwrights Horizons.

Success in these endeavors is not guaranteed; but Hot Diggity! boasts beautiful music, intricate lyrics, and a compelling, relatable story -- all ingredients for a successful musical. I believe the show has a bright future. But it requires the support of my friends, family, and theater enthusiasts everywhere!

Let's Make It Happen

Thank you for considering my campaign. With your financial support, we can launch Hot Diggity! to new heights. Together, we can bring this funny, thought-provoking musical to the stage.

story:
Short Summary

Good Morning New York opens Off-Broadway at the Players Theatre January 11, 2020. The musical about morning television is already making waves with rave reviews, sold out shows (during our 2018 run) and lots of buzz - despite being low budget.

Our musical has been invited to attend the prestigious BroadwayCon in January 2020.

In order to secure our booth, we need to raise $1,000 by December 1st.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Here's what we need to raise:

  • We need to raise $1,000 by December 1st.

 

Here's what you'll get:

  • Everyone who donates $25 gets a free album
  • Everyone who donates $100 gets a free album and pair of tickets to the show.
  • If you donate $150 or more you will get a free album and pair of tickets to opening night.

 

The Impact 

BroadwayCon is a major deal. Every Broadway show (and select Off-Braodway shows) will be in attendance. This will really help put our small show on the map.

The convention runs from Fri, Jan 24, 2020 – Sun, Jan 26, 2020.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our musical has been able to achieve more buzz than many equity Off-Broadway productions in a short time. Unfortunately, unlike equity productions, we do not have large marketing budgets.

Our fundraising mostly comes from friends, family, merchandise sales and pages like this.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can always follow us on Instagram.
  • Share our album on  your social media feed
  • Listen to use on Spotify

story:
Dear Valued Partners & Collaborators,

My name is Frank Mihelich and I’m the Artistic Director of New Threads Theatre Company. I have the great pleasure of leading a talented team of artists in launching our 2017 season of exciting and innovative programing.

Thanks to the generous contributions of people like yourself, our 2015-2016 season was a success. In the last year we have produced two full production, five staged readings through our In-dialogue Program, and two staged reading of a new work through our New Works Program.

In July of 2016 we had a strategic planning meeting where we assigned organizational roles to company members to prepare for our 2017 season of ambitious plays.

New Threads Theatre Company exists to tell provocative and entertaining stories, and create innovative theatrical events, that start inclusive conversations and build community.

We accomplish this through five exciting programs:

NEW WORKS DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM: (Program Directors: Carol Damgen & Amanda Rountree) Identifies and works with local and national playwrights to develop new scripts from rough to final draft.

In the 2017 season the New Works Program will organize and produce a New Works Short Play Festival and contest, produce two staged reading of new work, and host three “table-readings” of new plays in development.

IN-DIALOGUE PROGRAM: (Program Director: Ethan Park) Uses a unique format to present scaled-down “staged readings” of established plays that are immediately followed by forums, or “talk-backs” that engage audiences and theatre workers in a discussion of the work and themes presented.

During the 2017 season the In-Dialogue Program will produce five staged readings of entertaining and provocative titles, which will include a concert reading of a musical.

T-SHIRT SHAKESPEARE: (Program Directors: Kiana Miskel and Taylor Bjur) Is the education and outreach program of New Threads Theatre Company. The program will be made up of 6-8 New Threads Theatre Company associate members, who will tour schools (K-12) and perform scaled down productions of classical and academically required texts (i.e: Macbeth, The Crucible.)

Over the next year, the T-Shirt Shakespeare team will develop, cast, produce, and rehearse our first touring production that will start to tour to southern California schools in the fall of 2017.

COMPANY TRAINING: (Program Directors: Leah Moore, Kiana Miskel, and Gabrielle Green) New Threads Theatre Company members and associate members will meet for physical acting training every other week for two hours for physical actor training and company business. The physical training (Fundamentals Regimen) will provide the company with a weekly time to grow as individual artists and as a company, while creating a shared theatrical vocabulary. The company business hour will help organize and move the mission of the organization forward.

PRODUCTION PROGRAM: (Production Manager: Garret Replogle) Mounts full-scale productions of material that has already been “work-shopped” through the New Works Development Program as well as material that has been “work-shopped” through the In-Dialogue Program. The Production Program relies on both New Works and In-Dialogue, which generate content and build audiences (respectively) to achieve the New Threads primary objective of starting conversations and building community through theatre.

In 2017 we will produce two full productions. In January of 2017 we will co-producing, along with The Gestalt Theatre Project, Sam Shepard’s True West.

We are also proud to announce that Mandy Hyde has agreed to serve as New Threads Theatre Company’s first Managing Director. Mandy and I will lead the company through the process of becoming a not-for-profit (501c3). This distinction will make it possible for the company to apply for local, state, and national grants.

During the next year we will also be recruiting a board of directors and an advisory board.

WHAT MAKES NEW THREADS THEATRE COMPANY DIFFERENT?

The Inland Empire region of Southern California where we are based has a rich tradition of professional level musical theatre, however, non-musical theatre is almost exclusively produced on the amateur or community theatre level. New Threads Theatre Company has the potential to build a vibrant theatre company primarily dedicated to straight (non-musical theatre) plays and therefore become an important professional voice in the southern California theatre ecosystem.

We seek to build community through inclusive conversations, which is the soul of democracy; we will do this by facilitating post-show talk-backs after every show or reading between audience and cast. We are hoping that our audience will come for the show, stay for the conversation, and become part of the community.

PARTNER WITH US

We need your help to do this. Please consider partnering with us to bring excellent, professional level theatre to the Inland Empire region of southern California.

We need to raise $5000 to fund our 2017 season. This money will be used to rent the theatre, pay the cast and production team, and publicize the production.

We will gratefully accept any donation amount that you are willing to give from $1, $10, $20, $50 or more; however, we have created an exciting list of perks in the hopes that you will decide to commit to partnering with us.

My experience has taught me that you need three things to launch a theatre company: time, space, and money. However, the main element is money. If you have money you have time and space as well. Please consider donating a generous gift that will help us reach our realistic yet ambitious goal of $5,000.

We would also ask you to help us get the word out about this fundraising campaign by reaching out to contacts and friends that might be interested in supporting New Threads. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out.

Please join the conversation and decide to partner with us on this adventure.  Thank you.

Sincerely,

Frank Mihelich

Artistic Director

New Threads Theatre Company

story:
Tanagra Collective debuts new play about Dr. Henry Howard Holmes: the first modern Serial Killer!

We at Tanagra are proud to announce that Julian R. Munds’ new play, The Good Doctor Holmes & His Children of God will be premiering at the Theatre Passe Muraille Backspace, May 11 -21, 2017. But before we can get to opening night we need your help.

Theatre, even good theatre, in Toronto costs a lot of money to present. There’s costs for rental of the performance space, rental of rehearsal space, costuming and set building. That’s just the bare minimum. What happens if these artists get injured? Sick? Hungry? Where’s the money to protect them in their hour of need? This is why we at Tanagra come to you. We need your help.

One of the major reasons for high ticket prices in Toronto is the large overhead costs get passed on to the consumer. We at Tanagra know our show will be a hit. It’s exciting. Hilarious. Haunting. But we don’t want to share it with you at an exorbitant price. Therefore, if you have some money to toss our way we will use it in the most efficient way. Just 20 dollars could get us one hour of rehearsal time or 10% of safety insurance.

We are want to raise 3000 in the next month so that we can cover insurance costs and rehearsal space costs. Every little bit helps.

Tanagra was founded by Julian R. Munds, award winning actor, director, and sometimes historian to create vibrant work and challenging art for Canadians. Theatre has been relegated in Canada for a myriad of reasons. Julian and Tanagra wish to restore the thrill of new work and leave an impact on the minds of the people that sit in the audience.

"The Good Doctor Holmes..." has been a script that has floated around for three years now. It borrows from research into criminal psychology from the Quantico Bahavioral Archive in the US, actual contemporary accounts of the "Pitezel Case," in Toronto courts and papers, and modern perspectives from the actors creating the characters.

The subject matter that we are dealing with is difficult but it is not foreign. HH was man who used systemic problems for personal gain. He was a doctor and often held his knowledge over less advantaged people to confuse and gain results for himself. We see this all the time now in political and cultural debates. Although the events depicted took play in the 1890s they feel like they could have been ripped out of the news of today.

We need some help to complete our project through donations so that we can afford a safe rehearsal space and in the case of injury or disaster we can cover our costs. Theatre is difficult. The slightest donation can make it less so.

story:
(versão em português abaixo)

"All the world began with a yes. One molecule said yes to another molecule and life was born. But before prehistory there was the prehistory of the prehistory and there was the never and there was the yes."

(Clarice Lispector - The Hour of the Star)

​

Do you say "yes" to Clarice Lispector?

Do you say "yes" to Brazilian theater in NY?

Do you say "yes" to presenting Brazilian culture in NY through performing arts?

Do you say "yes" to Group .BR?

Do you say "yes" to an immersive theatrical experience on Clarice Lispector's works?

What do you say?

Some amazing artists said "yes" to this project and offered their art as a perk to those also saying "yes".

Yes?

Curious? Want to know more about all this? Just keep reading.

OVERVIEW

If you're a fan of Then She Fell, Queen of the Night and Sleep no More, you will definitely love INSIDE THE WILD HEART. Our upcoming play is a fully immersive theatrical experience which showcases the work of Clarice Lispector's, Brazil's most acclaimed female writer. Our vision is to create a sensory play that serves as an entry point to Clarice's incredible --yet still mostly unknown in the US-- work.

 

INTRO

Clarice Lispector (1920-1977) is Brazil's most acclaimed female writer. She was described  by researchers such as Iba Mendes and Benjamin Moser as the most important Jewish writer since Franz Kafka, with her trademark stream-of-consciousness writing style often being compared to that of Virginia Woolf and James Joyce. In fact, Clarice's Complete Stories was recognized among the best books of 2015 by the New York Times and the Boston Globe.

The underlying thread across Lispector’s work is the questioning of oneself and humanity. Her work is universal, transcending ethnicity, race, religion, time, gender and place. Many people say, and we agree, that you don’t just read Clarice, you experience it.

We believe that Clarice's amazing talent deserves to be shared beyond just Brazil. In a place as diverse and fast-paced as New York City, people deserve to have their hearts and minds touched by Clarice's incredible world view. This is how Inside the Wild Heart was born, an immersive theatrical experience to transport audiences directly inside Clarice Lispector’s heart, performed by the only Brazilian Theater Company in NYC.

Clarice used to say that "all the world began with a yes." And to turn Inside the Wild Heart into reality we need you to say "yes" too. Support us in making it happen! Your "yes" will be your key into the wonders of Clarice's heart.

 

ABOUT THE PLAY​

INSIDE THE WILD HEART will be a site-specific, fully immersive and participatory theatrical experience. The performance will happen in a house setting where the audience will be able to walk freely from room to room following the performers and interacting with the environment​. Our vision is to create a show that encourages audiences to be active participants rather than passive spectators, and engage with literature on a sensorial level.

 

ABOUT GROUP.BR

We are a group of Brazilian artists who live in New York. As the only Brazilian Theater Company in the city, our mission is to bring Brazilian culture to New York stages through the performing arts. We use physical theater --where body movement is a form of communication-- as our main tool to expose the works of most renowned Brazilian artists. We provide audiences with a deeper, more nuanced exploration of Brazilian culture, beyond the familiar depictions of the country, as well as the unique opportunity to enjoy Brazilian dramaturgy and the musicality of the Portuguese language.

 

Where/ Onde

Immersive Gallery - Williamsburg, Brooklyn

When

November 3rd to 20th

Where does the money goes

.Venue rental, rehearsals

.Costume and set

.Copyright 

.Marketing

.All the artists and other professionals committed with the project

Our real budget is U$60,000.00 but we want to be realistic about this campaign. If we do not achieve our goal in Indiegogo they get a larger percentage of the campaign. But even if we reach our goal, we still have a long way to go so we need your help like never before.

_____________________________________________

“Tudo no mundo começou com um sim. Uma molécula disse sim a outra molécula e nasceu a vida. Mas antes da pré-história havia a pré-história da pré-história e havia o nunca e havia o sim.”

(Clarice Lispector – A Hora da Estrela)

 

Você diz “sim” para Clarice Lispector?

Você diz “sim” para o teatro brasileiro em NY?

Você diz “sim” para apresentar a cultura brasileira em NY através das arte cênicas?

Você diz “sim” para o Group .BR?

Você diz “sim” para uma experiência teatral imersiva baseada na obra de Clarice Lispector?

O quê você diz?

Alguns artistas incríveis disseram “yes” para este projeto e ofereceram suas obras como recompensa para quem disser “sim”.

Sim?

GROUP .BR

A MISSÃO DO GRUPO .BR é trazer a cultura brasileira para NY através das artes cênicas. O teatro físico - onde o movimento do corpo é uma forma de comunicação - é a nossa principal ferramenta para expor os trabalhos dos artistas mais renomados do Brasil. Nossas peças são realizadas em Português com legendas em inglês. Nós fornecemos ao público de NY uma vivência mais profunda, com mais nuances da cultura brasileira, bem como a oportunidade única de desfrutar da dramaturgia brasileira ainda desconhecida e a musicalidade da língua Português.

SOBRE A PEÇA

Dentro do coração selvagem é uma experiência teatral site-specific totalmente envolvente e participativa, que transporta o público diretamente dentro do coração de Clarice Lispector. Essa experiência é vivida em um local que remete a uma casa, onde o público pode livremente andar de sala em sala seguindo os artistas e interagir com o ambiente. Cada quarto é uma instalação de arte inspirada por um elemento forte na escrita de Clarice.

Nossa visão é criar uma experiência sensorial que estimula o público a ser participante ativo, em vez de espectadores passivos, e se envolver com a literatura em um nível sensorial. O show, criado por Andressa Furletti e Debora Balardini e dirigido por Regina Miranda, integra artes visuais, cinema, música e arte performática para encarnar os sentimentos mais profundos da escritora. Dentro do Coração Selvagem segue linhas de produções teatrais performáticas de sucesso em NY, como Then She fell, Queen of the Night e Sleep no More.

PORQUÊ AJUDAR?

Clarice Lispector (1920 - 1977) é uma das mais importantes figuras literárias do Brasil. Ela, que já foi descrita como a mais importante escritora judia desde Franz Kafka, nasceu na Ucrânia e emigrou para o Brasil ainda criança, após a devastação da Primeira Guerra Mundial. Seu fluxo de consciência marca seu estilo de escrita, sendo muitas vezes comparada com a Virginia Woolf e James Joyce. Lispector é, infelizmente, relativamente desconhecida fora do Brasil. Com a recente tradução e publicação de seus contos completos e outros trabalhos selecionados, bem como a sua biografia, pelo autor Benjamin Moser, ela está ganhando apreço e reconhecimento dentro do universo literário da América. Na verdade, “Clarice – Contos Completos” foi reconhecido na lista do New York Times de livros notáveis de 2015, o canadense National Post o colocou na lista dos melhores livros do ano, Melhores Livros de 2015 pelo Boston Globe, e na lista dos 24 Melhores Livros de ficção de 2015 do BuzzFeed Books. O condutor de toda a obra de Lispector é o questionamento de si mesma e da humanidade. Sua obra é universal, transcendendo etnia, raça, religião, tempo, sexo e local. Muitas pessoas dizem, e nós concordamos, que você lê Clarice, você a experimenta. Esta experiência visceral de seu trabalho foi a inspiração para a concepção da performance imersiva Dentro do Coração Selvagem.

O que esperar

Uma experiência teatral site-specific totalmente envolvente e participativa, que transporta o público diretamente para dentro do coração de Clarice Lispector.

Where/ Onde

Immersive Gallery - Williamsburg, Brooklyn

When/Quando

November 3rd to 20th / de 03 a 20 de Novembro de 2016

Where does the money goes/Para onde vai o dinheiro:

.Rehearsals and theatre / Espaço de ensaio e teatro

.Costume and set / Figurino e cenário

.Copyright / Direitos autorais

.Marketing

.To pay all the artists and other professionals committed with the project /Compensar o tempo e o talento dos artistas envolvidos

 

Our real budget is U$60,000.00 but we want to be realistic about this campaign. If we do not achieve our goal in Indiegogo they get a larger percentage of the campaign. But even if we reach our goal, we still have a long way to go so we need your help like never before.

Nosso orçamento real é U$60.000,00 mas queremos ser realista sobre esta campanha. Se não atingirmos nossa meta no IndieGogo eles ficam com uma porcentagem maior sobre a arrecadação. Mas mesmo se atingirmos nossa meta, ainda temos um longo caminho pela frente precisamos de sua ajuda como nunca antes.

 

Thank you so much for your support to Group .BR and the production of "Inside the Wild Heart". We can assure you, your help it is much appreciated.

Muito obrigado por apoiar a criação do GROUP.BR e a produção de “Dentro do Coração Selvagem”. Podemos te garantir que a sua ajuda é muito apreciada por todos nós.
story_txt: (versão em português abaixo)"All the world began with a yes. One molecule said yes to another molecule and life was born. But before prehistory there was the prehistory of the prehistory and there was the never and there was the yes."(Clarice Lispector - The Hour of the Star)​Do you say "yes" to Clarice Lispector?Do you say "yes" to Brazilian theater in NY?Do you say "yes" to presenting Brazilian culture in NY through performing arts?Do you say "yes" to Group .BR?Do you say "yes" to an immersive theatrical experience on Clarice Lispector's works?What do you say?Some amazing artists said "yes" to this project and offered their art as a perk to those also saying "yes".Yes?Curious? Want to know more about all this? Just keep reading.OVERVIEWIf you're a fan of Then She Fell, Queen of the Night and Sleep no More, you will definitely love INSIDE THE WILD HEART. Our upcoming play is a fully immersive theatrical experience which showcases the work of Clarice Lispector's, Brazil's most acclaimed female writer. Our vision is to create a sensory play that serves as an entry point to Clarice's incredible --yet still mostly unknown in the US-- work. INTROClarice Lispector (1920-1977) is Brazil's most acclaimed female writer. She was described  by researchers such as Iba Mendes and Benjamin Moser as the most important Jewish writer since Franz Kafka, with her trademark stream-of-consciousness writing style often being compared to that of Virginia Woolf and James Joyce. In fact, Clarice's Complete Stories was recognized among the best books of 2015 by the New York Times and the Boston Globe.The underlying thread across Lispector’s work is the questioning of oneself and humanity. Her work is universal, transcending ethnicity, race, religion, time, gender and place. Many people say, and we agree, that you don’t just read Clarice, you experience it.We believe that Clarice's amazing talent deserves to be shared beyond just Brazil. In a place as diverse and fast-paced as New York City, people deserve to have their hearts and minds touched by Clarice's incredible world view. This is how Inside the Wild Heart was born, an immersive theatrical experience to transport audiences directly inside Clarice Lispector’s heart, performed by the only Brazilian Theater Company in NYC.Clarice used to say that "all the world began with a yes." And to turn Inside the Wild Heart into reality we need you to say "yes" too. Support us in making it happen! Your "yes" will be your key into the wonders of Clarice's heart. ABOUT THE PLAY​INSIDE THE WILD HEART will be a site-specific, fully immersive and participatory theatrical experience. The performance will happen in a house setting where the audience will be able to walk freely from room to room following the performers and interacting with the environment​. Our vision is to create a show that encourages audiences to be active participants rather than passive spectators, and engage with literature on a sensorial level. ABOUT GROUP.BRWe are a group of Brazilian artists who live in New York. As the only Brazilian Theater Company in the city, our mission is to bring Brazilian culture to New York stages through the performing arts. We use physical theater --where body movement is a form of communication-- as our main tool to expose the works of most renowned Brazilian artists. We provide audiences with a deeper, more nuanced exploration of Brazilian culture, beyond the familiar depictions of the country, as well as the unique opportunity to enjoy Brazilian dramaturgy and the musicality of the Portuguese language. Where/ OndeImmersive Gallery - Williamsburg, BrooklynWhenNovember 3rd to 20thWhere does the money goes.Venue rental, rehearsals.Costume and set.Copyright .Marketing.All the artists and other professionals committed with the projectOur real budget is U$60,000.00 but we want to be realistic about this campaign. If we do not achieve our goal in Indiegogo they get a larger percentage of the campaign. But even if we reach our goal, we still have a long way to go so we need your help like never before._____________________________________________“Tudo no mundo começou com um sim. Uma molécula disse sim a outra molécula e nasceu a vida. Mas antes da pré-história havia a pré-história da pré-história e havia o nunca e havia o sim.”(Clarice Lispector – A Hora da Estrela) Você diz “sim” para Clarice Lispector?Você diz “sim” para o teatro brasileiro em NY?Você diz “sim” para apresentar a cultura brasileira em NY através das arte cênicas?Você diz “sim” para o Group .BR?Você diz “sim” para uma experiência teatral imersiva baseada na obra de Clarice Lispector?O quê você diz?Alguns artistas incríveis disseram “yes” para este projeto e ofereceram suas obras como recompensa para quem disser “sim”.Sim?GROUP .BRA MISSÃO DO GRUPO .BR é trazer a cultura brasileira para NY através das artes cênicas. O teatro físico - onde o movimento do corpo é uma forma de comunicação - é a nossa principal ferramenta para expor os trabalhos dos artistas mais renomados do Brasil. Nossas peças são realizadas em Português com legendas em inglês. Nós fornecemos ao público de NY uma vivência mais profunda, com mais nuances da cultura brasileira, bem como a oportunidade única de desfrutar da dramaturgia brasileira ainda desconhecida e a musicalidade da língua Português.SOBRE A PEÇADentro do coração selvagem é uma experiência teatral site-specific totalmente envolvente e participativa, que transporta o público diretamente dentro do coração de Clarice Lispector. Essa experiência é vivida em um local que remete a uma casa, onde o público pode livremente andar de sala em sala seguindo os artistas e interagir com o ambiente. Cada quarto é uma instalação de arte inspirada por um elemento forte na escrita de Clarice.Nossa visão é criar uma experiência sensorial que estimula o público a ser participante ativo, em vez de espectadores passivos, e se envolver com a literatura em um nível sensorial. O show, criado por Andressa Furletti e Debora Balardini e dirigido por Regina Miranda, integra artes visuais, cinema, música e arte performática para encarnar os sentimentos mais profundos da escritora. Dentro do Coração Selvagem segue linhas de produções teatrais performáticas de sucesso em NY, como Then She fell, Queen of the Night e Sleep no More.PORQUÊ AJUDAR?Clarice Lispector (1920 - 1977) é uma das mais importantes figuras literárias do Brasil. Ela, que já foi descrita como a mais importante escritora judia desde Franz Kafka, nasceu na Ucrânia e emigrou para o Brasil ainda criança, após a devastação da Primeira Guerra Mundial. Seu fluxo de consciência marca seu estilo de escrita, sendo muitas vezes comparada com a Virginia Woolf e James Joyce. Lispector é, infelizmente, relativamente desconhecida fora do Brasil. Com a recente tradução e publicação de seus contos completos e outros trabalhos selecionados, bem como a sua biografia, pelo autor Benjamin Moser, ela está ganhando apreço e reconhecimento dentro do universo literário da América. Na verdade, “Clarice – Contos Completos” foi reconhecido na lista do New York Times de livros notáveis de 2015, o canadense National Post o colocou na lista dos melhores livros do ano, Melhores Livros de 2015 pelo Boston Globe, e na lista dos 24 Melhores Livros de ficção de 2015 do BuzzFeed Books. O condutor de toda a obra de Lispector é o questionamento de si mesma e da humanidade. Sua obra é universal, transcendendo etnia, raça, religião, tempo, sexo e local. Muitas pessoas dizem, e nós concordamos, que você lê Clarice, você a experimenta. Esta experiência visceral de seu trabalho foi a inspiração para a concepção da performance imersiva Dentro do Coração Selvagem.O que esperarUma experiência teatral site-specific totalmente envolvente e participativa, que transporta o público diretamente para dentro do coração de Clarice Lispector.Where/ OndeImmersive Gallery - Williamsburg, BrooklynWhen/QuandoNovember 3rd to 20th / de 03 a 20 de Novembro de 2016Where does the money goes/Para onde vai o dinheiro:.Rehearsals and theatre / Espaço de ensaio e teatro.Costume and set / Figurino e cenário.Copyright / Direitos autorais.Marketing.To pay all the artists and other professionals committed with the project /Compensar o tempo e o talento dos artistas envolvidos Our real budget is U$60,000.00 but we want to be realistic about this campaign. But even if we reach our goal, we still have a long way to go so we need your help like never before.Nosso orçamento real é U$60.000,00 mas queremos ser realista sobre esta campanha. Se não atingirmos nossa meta no IndieGogo eles ficam com uma porcentagem maior sobre a arrecadação. Mas mesmo se atingirmos nossa meta, ainda temos um longo caminho pela frente precisamos de sua ajuda como nunca antes. Thank you so much for your support to Group .BR and the production of "Inside the Wild Heart". We can assure you, your help it is much appreciated.Muito obrigado por apoiar a criação do GROUP.BR e a produção de “Dentro do Coração Selvagem”. story:
"So, What's It About?" 

Set in the 1920's, Thirst is about three people trapped on a raft in the middle of the ocean after the ship they were on sinks.  With a small amount of tweaking, we want to make the play feel relevant to a modern audience. Our Director is inspired by the work of Alexander McQueen, Andy Warhol and Stanley Kubrick, and with a talented production team with an eclectic mix of experience, we hope to bring you this story of survival, violence and human contact with a unique visual style.  It's a little bit weird, and a whole lot of wonderful!   

"Ok, So What Exactly Is The Project?"

Our project consists of a 2 week professional run of Thirst at the Space theatre on the Isle of Dogs, South-East London from the 28th February - 11th March 2017. 

Running parallel to this, the Director will run a series of workshops which will be held at schools in the local community, in order to widen pupil’s engagement with abstract/expressionist theatre.  This will also equip them with new skills in theatre making.

A debate will be held at the Young Vic on the relationship between ‘art, race and theatre-making, does it matter who is on the driving seat?’.

"Great! What Do You Need?"

We need £1000 in order to afford:

Costume and props for our beloved actors.  We want the play to feel as authentic as possible, and we are sure they would be grateful to be clothed during the production! 

A Lighting Designer.  We feel that light has a very important part to play in the production in order to give it the perfect atmosphere.  How will you know what is happening if it is in the dark! 

A Producer.  We want the play to reach the ears of as many people as possible, and a marketing whizz is the perfect person to do this!  

And lastly, Rehearsal Space!

This money will also help us cover any admin costs we will come up against 

"But What's In It For us?"

Apart from being able to brag to your friends about how you are supporting the arts and careers of emerging theatre makers in this country?  Well take a look at our rewards on the right hand side of the page! We think they are pretty nifty!

"Sorry, I Just Can't Contribute At This Moment In Time"

We understand that not everyone can donate, but if you still want to support the project in some way, then we would love it if you could share this page on Facebook, Twitter, hell even Snapchat! Lets spread the word!

story:
The HOME team are Dublin-based artists collaborating with the New Theatre, Temple Bar and with dramaturgical support from the Arts Council, Ireland. HOME was first presented during the Scene + Heard Festival 2017 as a work in progress and was warmly accepted by the audience, who's post-shows debates extended long into the night after the performance had finished. 

HOME will be performed at the New Theatre from January 22nd - February 3rd 2018. The play tackles important and hyper-relevant topics with a focus on the grey areas of consent and abortion rights in the legal system. 

The best thing about HOME? You get to decide Anna's fate. The audience hold the power in this four-hander, acting as jury for Anna's trial. Love a chance to practise voting? The ending of HOME is in your hands. The script will present to you both sides of the story, including facts on how a case like Anna's works in Ireland, and it's up to you to decide. 

There are quite a few costs that come alongside presenting a play for two weeks, including set, lighting, costume, marketing and administration costs. While we are a frugal bunch, well used to borrowing and making do or making cuts wherever we can, we still need to raise some money to support HOME on it's journey. Every penny of any donation, big or small, will be going towards our production costs, as listed above, and we have plenty of lovely perks for all of our generous supporters!

If you want to get to know the team behind HOME a little better, you can find our bios (plus lovely pics) below. 

What We Need & What You Get

Oh, you're still here. Great! So what is it that we need? And what for?

We are campaigning to raise €3,000 to stage HOME in January/February 2018.

  1. Approximately one third of this will go into venue and insurance costs.
  2. A little more than a third will be going into our set, lighting, costumes and props.
  3. The remainder will go towards printing (posters, flyers, programmes), advertising, online content production (video, press photography, promotional photography) and administrative costs.

Donations of any size really do go a long way. A €5 donation can buy us around 50 flyers, for example! Those 50 flyers will be helping us spread the word about HOME so that as many people as possible can enjoy the show.

And what do I get in return, says you? Well, not to worry! It being the festive season, we have plenty of generous perks for you to avail of! Our funders can choose from..

  • Tickets to see HOME! come and see the show in its full glory. Take matters into your own hands and vote on Anna's fate.
  • A personalised poster signed by the cast and crew to remember your contribution by.
  • We will name a character in the play after you. Seriously. This one goes to the very generous contributions. 
  • Are you contributing on behalf of a business or company? You will get free advertisement space in our programme, which will be free of charge to all who come to see HOME.
  • Our endless thanks - this one goes without saying!

If we don't achieve our target of €3,000, we will do our best to raise the difference by other means such as a fundraising event. If we still fall short of our goal, we will need to cut our expenditure on marketing and production, which means our outreach and audience attraction will be lower, and our design and aesthetic for the show more limited.

The Impact

HOME was inspired by the urge to explore what consent means in regard to Irish law, and the legal risk associated with seeking an abortion in Ireland. The audience for HOME are given a unique opportunity wherein they are presented with arguments from both sides in relation to the consent and abortion trial they act as jury for. The court-room scenes are interspersed with flashback scenes, giving them a further insight into how the events of the night in question played out, and where they stand. 

We believe that after watching HOME, the audience will leave with much more knowledge around the laws surrounding consent and abortion in Ireland. This is a topical show emerging onto the scene at a time when there is confusion and a constant reference to "grey areas". HOME will peak and satisfy peoples' need to know more on these topics.

Playwright, Megan O'Malley has had dramaturgical support from the Arts Council and the New Theatre in the final drafts of this play.

Risks & Challenges

There are a number of risks and challenges we may come across during our campaign and as we move into rehearsal for the show. However, the HOME team each have experience working professionally in theatre, and therefore we are confident that pooling our experience, talent and resources will result in a really powerful show. We are risking running up personal debts if we don't meet our target. HOME will be performed in early 2018, whether we meet our campaign goal or not. 

How will we surmount this challenge if faced with it? Buckets of positive energy never go amiss because the show must go on at the end of the day (it's the night). Meticulous budgeting is vital to the success of a production of this scale, researching several pricing options for anything that needs to be purchased (as opposed to borrowed, rented or homemade), and running a strong marketing campaign with good images, video and press in advance of the performances. These elements being rock-solid will help us to overcome the risks and challenges we may face.

HOME is an important piece of new Irish theatre, and we hope that you can contribute to it!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you would absolutely love to contribute, but when you turn your pockets inside out, all that's in there is lint and an old pack of Extra with only one gum left in it. If you can't make a contribution, there are lots of other ways you can help :-)

  • Share, like, tweet, insta, snap! A single share on Facebook is worth on average a €5 donation! Please share and spread the word.
  • Is someone wondering what to get you for Christmas? Ask for a contribution for your Christmas present ;-) Santa has an endless supply of money.
  • Check your pockets again later, the campaign is running for 30 days.
  • Come see HOME. We'd love to see you there and we cannot wait to hear what you think of the show.

If you would like to contribute, but aren't sure, do! Just kidding, if you have any questions about your contribution, please contact producer for HOME, Kelley Gissane, on gissanekelley@gmail.com

Meet The Team

Writer & Actor, Megan O'Malley

Megan is a currently a 'Masters in Theatre Practice' student in University College Dublin. Previous to this she graduated from the Gaiety School of Acting’s two year full time course in 2015. Since graduating she has worked with Smashing Times Youth Ensemble to create "Flaming Inspirations and again to present Women of 1916 playing Countess Markievicz, Margaret Skinnider, and Helena Moloney. Megan has also played Queen Elizabeth in ‘Grainne’, and has worked on several short films including 'Rising', 'The Nest', 'Lilith' etc . She also stared in Kerry Golds latest TV commercial and We Cut Corners music video 'Of whatever' by Stoneface Films. Megan was awarded the Gaiety Theatre Bursary, 2014. While training she took on many roles, including: Runt in Disco Pigs, Ophelia in Hamlet, Kate in The Taming of the Shrew, and Mags in The Spinning Heart. Megan also played Melissa in The Full Moon Hotel by Philip Doherty More recently recently Megan won the  F.A.B. bursary award for Best Actress 16-21.Megan is also a passionate writer and was the first in the school’s history to premier her own work ‘MJ’ for the GSA graduation industry showcase. She also worked alongside Paul Meade for her Manifesto piece ‘The Mourning Seat’. From there Megan worked with Paul Meade over 2016 in developing her idea for  'Home', and was thrilled to present it as part of  Smock Allies  Scene and Heard festival for new work in 2017. Megan has since expanded 'Home' to a full length production and it will be premiering in The New Theatre in 2018. 

Director, Fiona Frawley

Fiona is a graduate of the Gaiety School of Acting and an MA in Advanced Theatre Practice (Royal Central School of Speech and Drama). She has cowrote, and performed in shows such as That's So 90's (2017), and Welcome to Sidebank (2017) in London and Beauty Queen Dreams (2016) in Dublin. Home is Fiona's directing debut. She is also a performer of stand up comedy. 

Set Designer, Áine O' Hara 

Áine is a visual artist and theatre maker originally from Co. Mayo. Áine has a B.A. in Fine Art from IADT, Dun Laoghaire and an MFA in Stage Design from The Lir, Trinity College Dublin. Design credits include: ‘I’m Your Man’ at Project Arts Centre as part of Dublin Theatre Festival,  ‘Red Pill' by Liam Hallahan at Theatre Upstairs and 'Saharcasm' by Sahar Ali at Smock Alley Theatre. Áine has also worked as a set dresser for TV, most recently on TV3's 'Red Rock'. aineohara.com/

Producer, Kelley Gissane

Kelley has worked in an administrative capacity in two major Irish arts organisations; Dublin Theatre Festival and the Gate Theatre, Dublin. Kelley fulfilled the role of Artistic Intern at Dublin Theatre Festival in 2015 which saw her research international festivals, co-producing, programming, curating and international visiting companies. In the Gate Theatre, Dublin, she worked as P.A to the Director & General Administrator. Producing training includes a six day course spread over five months of Creative Producer Training at Smock Alley Theatre: Smock Generator Course as part of the Scene + Heard Festival 2017 and two day intensive course in Producer Training with Irish Theatre Institute in association with The Lir Academy of Dramatic Arts. Producing credits include Bump (Assembly Festival, Edinburgh Fringe 2017), Home (Smock Alley), Broken Strings (Smock Alley), New History (Smock Alley), Girls Like That (The New Theatre), Othello (UCD Dramsoc), In. A. Hoop. (Smock Alley), bedbound (UCD Dramsoc & The Lir), The 39 Steps, The Glass Menagerie, All My Sons.

How will we surmount this challenge if faced with it? Buckets of positive energy never go amiss because the show must go on at the end of the day (it's the night). Meticulous budgeting is vital to the success of a production of this scale, researching several pricing options for anything that needs to be purchased (as opposed to borrowed, rented or homemade), and running a strong marketing campaign with good images, video and press in advance of the performances. These elements being rock-solid will help us to overcome the risks and challenges we may face.
HOME is an important piece of new Irish theatre, and we hope that you can contribute to it!

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand if you would absolutely love to contribute, but when you turn your pockets inside out, all that's in there is lint and an old pack of Extra with only one gum left in it. If you can't make a contribution, there are lots of other ways you can help :-)

Share, like, tweet, insta, snap! A single share on Facebook is worth on average a €5 donation! Please share and spread the word.
Is someone wondering what to get you for Christmas? Ask for a contribution for your Christmas present ;-) Santa has an endless supply of money.
Check your pockets again later, the campaign is running for 30 days.
Come see HOME. We'd love to see you there and we cannot wait to hear what you think of the show.

If you would like to contribute, but aren't sure, do! Just kidding, if you have any questions about your contribution, please contact producer for HOME, Kelley Gissane, on gissanekelley@gmail.com
Meet The Team
Writer & Actor, Megan O'Malley
Megan is a currently a 'Masters in Theatre Practice' student in University College Dublin. Previous to this she graduated from the Gaiety School of Acting’s two year full time course in 2015. Since graduating she has worked with Smashing Times Youth Ensemble to create "Flaming Inspirations and again to present Women of 1916 playing Countess Markievicz, Margaret Skinnider, and Helena Moloney. Megan has also played Queen Elizabeth in ‘Grainne’, and has worked on several short films including 'Rising', 'The Nest', 'Lilith' etc . She also stared in Kerry Golds latest TV commercial and We Cut Corners music video 'Of whatever' by Stoneface Films. Megan was awarded the Gaiety Theatre Bursary, 2014. While training she took on many roles, including: Runt in Disco Pigs, Ophelia in Hamlet, Kate in The Taming of the Shrew, and Mags in The Spinning Heart. Megan also played Melissa in The Full Moon Hotel by Philip Doherty More recently recently Megan won the  F.A.B. bursary award for Best Actress 16-21.Megan is also a passionate writer and was the first in the school’s history to premier her own work ‘MJ’ for the GSA graduation industry showcase. She also worked alongside Paul Meade for her Manifesto piece ‘The Mourning Seat’. From there Megan worked with Paul Meade over 2016 in developing her idea for  'Home', and was thrilled to present it as part of  Smock Allies  Scene and Heard festival for new work in 2017. Megan has since expanded 'Home' to a full length production and it will be premiering in The New Theatre in 2018. 

Director, Fiona Frawley
Fiona is a graduate of the Gaiety School of Acting and an MA in Advanced Theatre Practice (Royal Central School of Speech and Drama). She has cowrote, and performed in shows such as That's So 90's (2017), and Welcome to Sidebank (2017) in London and Beauty Queen Dreams (2016) in Dublin. Home is Fiona's directing debut. She is also a performer of stand up comedy. 

Set Designer, Áine O' Hara 
Áine is a visual artist and theatre maker originally from Co. Mayo. Áine has a B.A. in Fine Art from IADT, Dun Laoghaire and an MFA in Stage Design from The Lir, Trinity College Dublin. Design credits include: ‘I’m Your Man’ at Project Arts Centre as part of Dublin Theatre Festival,  ‘Red Pill' by Liam Hallahan at Theatre Upstairs and 'Saharcasm' by Sahar Ali at Smock Alley Theatre. Áine has also worked as a set dresser for TV, most recently on TV3's 'Red Rock'. aineohara.com/

Producer, Kelley Gissane
Kelley has worked in an administrative capacity in two major Irish arts organisations; Dublin Theatre Festival and the Gate Theatre, Dublin. Kelley fulfilled the role of Artistic Intern at Dublin Theatre Festival in 2015 which saw her research international festivals, co-producing, programming, curating and international visiting companies. In the Gate Theatre, Dublin, she worked as P.A to the Director & General Administrator. Producing training includes a six day course spread over five months of Creative Producer Training at Smock Alley Theatre: Smock Generator Course as part of the Scene + Heard Festival 2017 and two day intensive course in Producer Training with Irish Theatre Institute in association with The Lir Academy of Dramatic Arts. Producing credits include Bump (Assembly Festival, Edinburgh Fringe 2017), Home (Smock Alley), Broken Strings (Smock Alley), New History (Smock Alley), Girls Like That (The New Theatre), Othello (UCD Dramsoc), In. A. Hoop. (Smock Alley), bedbound (UCD Dramsoc & The Lir), The 39 Steps, The Glass Menagerie, All My Sons.

story:
Short Summary

In a once-prosperous town left ravaged by never ending war, a nineteen year-old girl is on trial. She has reopened a long conflict, and lit a fire under the rebel cause. The government has at last caught up with her, and the punishment they seek is death. But there are complications. The girl refuses to tell the truth. She urges her judges to think of their souls. She says God will punish them if they hurt her. The girl is her own, and only, lawyer. She is surrounded by educated men who will use any means to find the legal loophole which makes the most convenient noose. The girl is a warrior, a martyr, a witch. The girl is Joan of Arc.

Playwright Alexandra Ranieri and director Iris Sowlat were chosen to bring this fresh re-telling of Joan of Arc's story to RhinoFest in Chicago this January. RhinoFest is Chicago's oldest fringe festival, and brings several well-curated full productions of world premiere plays to life every January.  

The artistic team is on their own to produce this play, under the umbrella of their new company, Abaissés Theatre, whose name is taken from a group of scrappy, intellectual French Revolutionaries, Les Amis de l'Abaissé ("friends of the abased"), and literally means "Theatre for the abased" or "Theatre for the underdogs."  

Our largest production expense will be compensating all of this production's artists fairly. Director Iris Sowlat values the creativity, time, and labor of other artists, above anything else, and wants to make sure that our team receives stipends comparable to other small non-Equity theatre companies. 

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to raise $1,000, for the following artist payroll breakdown:

  • $450 total for a cast of 9 actors 
  • $100 for a stage-manager
  • $100 for a fight choreographer
  • $320 for a team of four production designers (costumes, lighting, projections. sound)
  • $30 for a graphic designer 

In exchange for helping us compensate our team for their time and talent, some of the perks you could receive include:

  • A signed, handwritten note from the playwright
  • Your name listed on social media and the play program 
  • Coffee or drinks with the playwright and director
  • Dinner and drinks with the cast and crew
  • Complimentary tickets to the play 
  • A custom poem written for you, by Alexandra Ranieri
  • A signed poetry book by Alexandra Ranieri

The Impact

Your contribution will have the following impact:

  • Every dollar from this campaign will be used to compensate actors, designers, a certified fight choreographer, and a stage manager for their work on Joan of Arc. 
  • This production will help bring an important and timely story- see through a fresh lens- to the stage. 

Risks & Challenges

Producing DIY theatre always involves risks. Fortunately, the Chicago theatre community is built for young, DIY companies such as this one. Additionally, Iris Sowlat has previous experience producing and directing self-produced works, including two full productions for the Chicago Fringe Festival, and multiple shows, cabarets, happenings, and events for Pride Arts Center, NoPassport Theatre Alliance, Theatre Without Borders, and the Chicago Women's History Council, to name a few. She has also directed plays, readings, and festival pieces for Broken Nose Theatre, the Chicago Theatre Marathon, Collaboraction, and 20% Theatre. 

For this project, paying our artists is the only large expense. RhinoFest provides performances space for the show's 5-week run completely free of charge, with built-in tech time in the space, and built-in marketing through the festival. We have secured nearly-free rehearsal space, and we have connections to borrow props and costume pieces for nearly no cost. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at the moment, other ways to help our show and our artists include:

  • See Joan of Arc at RhinoFest, playing every Thursday at 7pm, from January 25-February 22, 2017
  • Share this campaign! 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Story

In 2016, MCIF was created by improvisers Eva Gilliam (USA/SA) and Ashley Comeau (CAN), and hosted by local Cape Town troupe The Long Shots.

Both Eva and Ashley saw a gap in the South African Improv Comedy community, South African improvisors are desperate to grow their small community and spread the improv love as well as build on their own improv knowledge and education. Instead of South African Improvisors spending huge amounts of money to travel overseas to get improv training and exposure, Eva and Ash thought it would be better to bring the teachers and players to them... and so MCIF was born!

A bit about Eva and Ashley:

Eva (The Long Shots) hails from New York, USA who moved to South Africa 15 years ago. She is an improvisor, filmmaker, and multi-media consultant based in Cape Town and working across the African continent. Ashley (Lusty Mannequins) is an actor/improviser, producer, writer and instructor based out of Toronto, Canada. In 2015 she was named Toronto's Best Female Improviser by Now Magazine's "Best Of" Awards. 

 

What is improv?

Improvisation, or improv, is a form of live theatre made up in the moment, without use of an already prepared, written script. It is an exciting and vibrant live performance where the audience and performers interact to make spontaneous and hilarious theatre on the spot. 

As much as improv is a great tool to use in comedy and performance, it isn't just for performers. Improvisation tools and techniques extend way beyond the stage and can be used in businesses, schools or communities to promote communication, confidence, collaboration, trust, problem solving, leadership and creativity.

In essence learning and playing improvisation creates a community of people who think outside the box, can create something from nothing, and love to laugh. It crosses social and economic lines, bringing people of all backgrounds into a playful environment – it’s a no-brainer for social cohesion through laughter and play. Now, wouldn’t you love to be a part of that?

 

What happens at MCIF?

Courses all day, shows all night... Over the course of the 5-day festival we'll have short and longer intensive courses for beginners to advanced hosted by some of the world's most experienced and talented improvisors. When the sun sets, we'll have a line of up local and international teams perform some of the freshest and funniest improv comedy to hit African shores.

Last year we had 7 troupes perform and were over 90% sold out across all our shows. This year we are aiming to have at least 10 troupes, local and international. Our applications to performers have already opened and we are set to have some amazing talent grace our stages! We'll also have mixed teams for individual festival participants who don't have a team.

Every night closes with an open jam where all are welcome (players and audience) to jump up on stage together and try out some fun improv games devised and hosted by an MCIF improviser.

 

What we need...

Our biggest and most important cost is getting our 5 international teachers over to South Africa. This year our teachers list includes some of the world's finest improvisors: Ashley Comeau (CAN), Connor Thompson (CAN), Alastair Forbes (CAN), Stefan Pagels Andersen (DEN) and one more special guest from Europe/USA still to be confirmed. They will be hosting various improv workshops, from beginner to advanced as well as showcasing their talents in the evenings at our shows alongside other local and international performers.

South Africa is far way away from the rest of the world and it cost a pretty penny to get here. 1 flight from Canada to South Africa costs around $1 250, yikes! The  total $7 500 Travel costs include: Flights, accommodation and daily subsistence allowance... anything left over from that will go to paying our teachers as salary (That's right, our amazing teachers have very generously agreed to not take a salary if the funds aren't available!).

The remaining $2 500 goes to venue hire, lighting and sound hire as well as promotional costs - to spread the word about the fest and the public involved!

All of the proceeds of the festival go back into the MCIF fund for 2018 and also helps to pay for all the awesome people involved - teachers, producers, photographers, graphic designers and taking care of our MCIF volunteers during the festival.

 

What you get...

We want you to get as excited about MCIF as we are so we have included some awesome perks. From social media shout outs, show and workshop tickets to kick ass swag bags which include t-shirts, notebooks and stickers. It's a great way to get your hands on some early bird tickets to the festival at great prices!

We understand that some of our backers won't be able to attend the festival so will have no use for the show and workshop tickets. No problemo! You can spread the improv love by donating your tickets to our raffle jar. Leading up to the festival various lucky draws will be held and festival goers will stand a chance to win your tickets - this way you get to support someone's improv dream to take a workshop or watch a show!

Business owner? Back us from $500 and up and we'll promote your business through multiple social media and show shout outs, letting our audience know who you are! You will also be mentioned on our Major Supporters List on our website.

Want more? From $2500 you'll receive an Executive Producer & Sponsor credit with your logo on our website, festival programme and other printed PR along with multiple social media and show mentions - letting people know more about your company!

If you are a company based in Cape Town we also offer a 2 day team building improv workshop (of up to 30 employees) for your business where your employees will spend the day with one of our local experienced improvisors who will host games and formats used to promote confidence, trust and communication in the work place all while having a tonne of fun!

The show must go on!

If we don't reach our goal, MCIF still happens - even if it means we'll have to scale back drastically on how many international teachers we can bring to the festival. We'll cut costs wherever we can. Fortunately the MCIF team are hustlers and super passionate about growing the improv community in South Africa, so no matter what, we will do our best to make sure this festival happens!

Let's think positively though... we are hoping to end up with more funds than what we've quoted for. If this happens then the festival gets even better and bigger venues, more PR, more teachers and also sponsoring other international performer's travel to join the fest!

 

The impact...

By growing MCIF each year and exposing local improvisors to international teachers and players we are assuring that the South African improv community builds it's experience and knowledge base to further promote and teach improv skills and principles in schools, communities and businesses.

As well as further educating improvisors and creating a platform for them to grow, at MCIF we also offer courses for non-performers, people who are simply interested in having some fun, thinking out of the box and seeing what this improv thing is all about. We don't discriminate against experience, age or language (except maybe against the humorless).

What kind of courses?

Beginner courses:  Improv 101s for the total novice - get your feet wet and see what it's all about! Then for the not so novice, but not yet intermediate - getting in more practice with professional coaching!

Intermediate courses in short form improv: polish your improv skills, learn new games, challenge yourself with new concepts and approaches in short and long-form improv options.

Advanced courses:  Go deep and break apart your playing, learn new techniques, recognise bad habits and take your improv even higher!

Musical course:  Learn to improvise with music - create songs and play with your voice and rhythms.  

Teens course: With a focus on building an ensemble, teens develop their teamwork and listening skills in a non-judgemental and respectful environment where they are able to explore and expand their creativity.

 

The MCIF Teachers (Instructors, Profs, Specialists): CHECK www.mamacityimprovfest.com for a workshop lineup!

Alaistair Forbes (Canada)

Alastair is a Second City Mainstage Alumni and a three time nominee for Canada's best male improviser. He's been improvising and teaching professionally for over a decade with the Bad Dog Theatre, Comedy Bar and The Second City. He's attended numerous international improv festivals and was voted the top member of the International Ensemble at the Vancouver Improv Festival. He's improvised and worked numerous greats like Colin Mochrie, Ryan Stiles, Dave Foley. He writes comedy for TV and in his spare time plays far too much disc golf. 

Alastair will perform at MCIF2017 with Lusty Mannequins.

Connor Thompson (Canada)


Connor is an actor, writer, and improvisor from Toronto, Canada. At Second City he wrote and performed in three main-stage reviews, winning a Canadian Comedy award in the process. With his troupe Lusty Mannequins he has taught and performed improv around the world, including in festivals in London, Barcelona, Dublin - and at the inaugural MamaCity Improv Festival in 2016. As a faculty member at the Second City Toronto training centre, he has taught hundreds of students, from beginners to veterans and everyone in between, and he's excited to return to Cape Town to meet the next batch of up-and-coming improvisors from the Mama City!

Connor will be performing with Lusty Mannequins.

Follow him on twitter @cpethompson!

Stefan Pagels Andersen (Denmark)

Stefan is an improviser and actor, and has performed in more than 8 Danish Feature films. He studied at Improv Olympic and has been a professional performing improviser since 2009.  In 2013 he organized the Copenhagen International Improv Festival, that facilitated more than 60 International Improvisers. 

Due to the Festival’s success, he was invited back to the iO to shadow teach some of the worlds best instructors by iO founder Charna Halpern. He has traveled in over 35 cities in the world studying, teaching and performing, some with the worlds best improv performers TJ and Dave www.tjanddave.com – on a tour shadowing their classes and doing shows.

In early 2016, he opened the 1st ever professional improv theatre in Denmark, The ICC Theatre - which was just awarded BEST STAGE IN COPENHAGEN, after only 10 months open.

Stefan will be performing with the Mixed Team and other configurations.

Bill Binder (USA)

Bill began performing in 1994 in Michigan and has been performing in Phoenix, Arizona since 2000. Bill has been producing the Phoenix Improv Festival since 2002 and is a teacher and performer at The Torch Theatre. Bill has enjoyed traveling across North America and Europe learning new styles of play and is very excited to perform for the first time in South Africa.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1000079...

Twitter: http://twitter.com/whbinder

Improv Network: http://www.theimprovnetwork.org/members/whbinder

Misch Whitaker (USA)


Misch Whitaker, the resident director at Catalyst Comedy, has been performing and teaching improv for over ten years. Past credits include TheaterSports/FaceOff at ImprovBoston (2007-2008); NXT at Improv Asylum (2007-2008); Improv Asylum Mainstage (2008-2012) and ImprovBoston Mainstage (2013-2014). She's the smaller half of the two person musical improv show Pat and Misch Break Up, and is a member of the international touring company Big Bang.  Misch coaches and teaches improv for kids of all ages at various schools and community organizations, and is an adult improv instructor at ImprovBoston's Comedy School. Back at Catalyst Comedy, she co-created a children's show called KERPLUNK!  and directs and performs with Boston's Unscripted Musical Project (B.U.M.P.), and Dirty Disney.

Misch will be performing with B.U.M.P!

Kevin Miller (USA)

Kevin Miller has performed, coached, and taught improv in Austin, Texas for over 15 years. He is the dean of the Merlin Works Institute of Improvisation at the ZACH Theatre in downtown Austin. He has teaching experience around the US, and as far afield as Finland and Estonia. Kevin owns one dog, two cats, and 12 chickens.

http://i.imgur.com/yWO9q89

https://www.facebook.com/happywaffle

https://www.twitter.com/happywaffle

 
 

Other ways you can support MCIF...

Some people just can't contribute financially, we get that, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

You can help get the word out about MCIF 2017 and make some noise about our Indiegogo Campaign! Tell your friends and family, follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram @mamacityif . Join our mailing list for updates by visiting our site www.mamacityimprovfest.com

You can also use the Indiegogo share tools to let others know about our campaign!

#MCIF2017 #Improv #Comedy #CapeTown #SouthAfrica

For more info about MCIF 2017 please visit our website or drop us an email with any questions you may have.

Can't wait for you to be part of the MCIF family!

Much Love,

The MCIF team xxx
